caption: #: ; Following an exchange of intelligence between CNB and the Narcotics Bureau of the Hong Kong Police Force (HKNB), CNB officers arrested five female foreign nationals (aged 21 to 48) for suspected drug trafficking offences in the transit area of Changi Airport Terminal 4 on 29 July.CNB officers spotted two of the women (a 21-year-old and a 32-year-old) exchanging luggage and acted quickly to arrest all five women. A total of about 26.9kg of cocaine concealed within stuffed toys and 10g of cannabis were recovered from a search of their belongings.SAC Sng Chern Hong, Covering Director of CNB, said: CNB thanks the Narcotics Bureau of the Hong Kong Police Force for their sharing of intelligence which led to this large seizure of drugs, and we stand ready to work with our close counterparts to disrupt drug syndicates and their operations. Those who attempt to traffic drugs through Singapore will be stopped and dealt with in accordance with the law. Singapore is not a transit point for drug smugglers and we will not allow our travel hubs to be misused for criminal activity. This operation demonstrates our firm, zero tolerance stance against drugs.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 30g of cocaine, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio
cleaned_caption: Following an exchange of intelligence between CNB and the Narcotics Bureau of the Hong Kong Police Force, CNB officers arrested five female foreign nationals (aged 21 to 48) for suspected drug trafficking offences in the transit area of Changi Airport Terminal 4 on 29 July. CNB officers spotted two of the women (a 21-year-old and a 32-year-old) exchanging luggage and acted quickly to arrest all five women. A total of about 26.9kg of cocaine concealed within stuffed toys and 10g of cannabis were recovered from a search of their belongings. SAC Sng Chern Hong, Covering Director of CNB, said: CNB thanks the Narcotics Bureau of the Hong Kong Police Force for their sharing of intelligence which led to this large seizure of drugs, and we stand ready to work with our close counterparts to disrupt drug syndicates and their operations. Those who attempt to traffic drugs through Singapore will be stopped and dealt with in accordance with the law. Singapore is not a transit point for drug smugglers and we will not allow our travel hubs to be misused for criminal activity. This operation demonstrates our firm, zero tolerance stance against drugs. Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 30g of cocaine, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing.

caption: #: : . , On 23 June 2025, CNB officers arrested a 33-year-old Singaporean man for suspected drug trafficking offences in a residential unit near Balam Road. A total of 2,722g of cannabis, with an estimated worth of more than $65,000, was seized from within the unit, and could potentially feed the addiction of 390 abusers for a week.The Singapore Governments stand on illicit drugs, including cannabis, is clear - they are harmful, addictive and can destroy lives, families and communities. CNB would like to remind the public that cannabis is a Class A controlled drug listed under Singapores Misuse of Drugs Act (MDA) in Singapore. The consumption, possession, trafficking, import or export of any controlled drugs, including cannabis and cannabis products, is an offence under the MDA. Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspect are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspect are ongoing.

caption: 1.4 A 30-year-old Malaysian man was arrested for attempting to smuggle drugs in a Malaysian-registered car arriving at Woodlands Checkpoint in the evening of 14 June 2025. ICA officers had directed the car for enhanced checks and found a bundle believed to contain controlled drugs behind the glove compartment of the car. CNB officers were immediately alerted and conducted further checks which uncovered two more bundles from the same location within the car. The bundles were later found to contain about 1,402g of heroin, 495g of cannabis and 115g of Ice. The drugs seized have an estimated worth of more than $173,000 and could potentially feed the addiction of about 800 abusers for a week.Investigations are ongoing. Under Section 7 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, those who import into or export from Singapore more than 15g of diamorphine or pure heroin may face the death penalty. ICA and CNB will continue to prevent attempts to smuggle drugs across our borders. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbioCNBOnTheMove OneHomeTeam

caption: #: The 30-year-old male foreign national was on his e-bike when CNB officers approached him during an operation near Bendemeer Road on 10 June. Abandoning his e-bike, he fled the scene and was seen discarding a bag into Kallang River. The recovered bag contained about 2,004g of cannabis and 518g of Ice, with an estimated worth of $110,200 and could feed the addiction of about 580 drug abusers for a week.CNB subsequently identified the suspect and arrested him for suspected drug trafficking offences during a follow-up operation on 12 June. He was apprehended at the entrance of a condominium near Kampong Eunos where he resided. Various drug paraphernalia were also seized from his residential unit.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 250g of methamphetamine, or 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspect are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: - - , $,CNB arrested 139 suspected drug offenders in an islandwide anti-drug operation from 18 to 30 May 2025. Drugs seized included about 3,588g of heroin, 2,744g of cannabis, 1,303g of Ice, 155g of ketamine, 54g of Ecstasy, 26g of cocaine and 22 LSD stamps. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $626,700 and could potentially feed the addiction of 2,840 abusers for a week. The youngest arrested in this island-wide operation was a 14-year-old student for suspected drug abuse.Some areas covered in the islandwide ops included Ang Mo Kio, Boon Keng, Bukit Merah, Jurong and Sengkang. In the early morning of 23 May, CNB officers arrested five male foreign nationals in the vicinity of Tuas South Avenue, aged between 23 and 34, for suspected drug offences. Two men, aged 25 and 34, put up a struggle to resist arrest and necessary force was used to subdue them. A 23-year-old man was spotted by CNB officers in the process of disposing of substances believed to be drugs. The disposed items, including about 2g of cannabis, were seized and the 23-year-old was arrested. A 24-year-old man was found with a small amount of Ice; and a total of about 27g of cannabis was found in a room in a residential lodging in the vicinity. The 32-year-old lodger was arrested for possession of a controlled drug.In the afternoon of 28 May, CNB officers raided a hotel room in the vicinity of Geylang Lorong 10 and arrested a 46-year-old man for suspected drug trafficking offences. Forced entry was effected as the man refused to comply with the lawful orders of the officers to open the door. A search of the room found about 2,818g of heroin, 565g of Ice, 20g of cannabis, 24g of ketamine, four Erimin-5 tablets and cash of $541.61.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: On 16 May, about 500 guests, including members of the Inter-Ministry Committee on Drug Prevention (IMC), community partners, student representatives and foreign guests came together to remember the victims of drug abuse.Mr K Shanmugam, Minister for Home Affairs and Minister for Law, led the observance ceremony. The ceremony also featured performance by the Yellow Ribbon Alumni Band, and appearances by the cast and director of this years campaign films.Lets continue to remember the victims of drug abuse, and play our part in building a drug-free Singapore.RememberUs RememberTheVictims DrugVictimsRemembranceDay DrugVictimsRemembranceDay2025

caption: . 41-year-old Singaporean man was arrested for attempting to smuggle a large amount of drugs including about 4.7kg of heroin in a Malaysian-registered car arriving at Woodlands Checkpoint in the evening of 16 April 2025.On 16 April, ICA officers conducted enhanced checks on a car when they noticed the passenger exhibiting suspicious behaviour. During the search, they found a slab of 10 tablets believed to be controlled drugs on him and CNB officers were immediately alerted to the detection. Officers then conducted further checks on the man and the car. A total of about 4.7kg of heroin, 3.3kg of cannabis, 1.6kg of Ice, among other drugs and cash were seized. In the early morning of 17 April, CNB officers escorted the man to his residence in the vicinity of Woodlands Drive. More drugs, including ketamine, Ice and Ecstasy, were recovered from within the unit. The drugs seized have an estimated worth of more than SGD845,500 and could potentially feed the addiction of about 3,730 abusers for a week.Under Section 7 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, those who import into or export from Singapore more than 15g of diamorphine or pure heroin, or more than 250g of methamphetamine, or more than 500g of cannabis may face the death penalty.ICA and CNB will continue to prevent attempts to smuggle drugs across our borders.OneHomeTeam CNBOnTheMove

caption: Behind the Scenes at the Drugfree SG Video Competition Videography Workshop! Here's what went down at last Saturday's Videography Workshop! Our participants learnt about the art of storytelling and got filmmaking tips from our expert filmmakers. Here are some of them! Plan before you shoot - storyboarding and scheduling are key to ensure you don't miss any key footage and maximise efficiency on shoot day. Use the right gear but no need for overkill! For better quality, add a microphone for cleaner audio, a small light to improve visibility and power bank to stay powered on the go. Be a human first. Take time to understand the people you interview. Documentary making is like fishing - patience is key. Patience must be paired with research for thoughtful preparation to capture genuine human stories. For impactful teasers, less is more: keep some mystery and spark curiosity by sharing just enough to hook the audience. This keeps them wanting more and increases engagement and shares. Whats your favourite part about video storytelling? Drop a comment below! BehindTheScenes VideographyWorkshop Uninfluenced AreWeUninfluenced DrugFreeSG

caption: #: -- , . CNB conducted an operation on 19 March, where drugs including about 6.9kg of cannabis, with an estimated worth of more than SGD184,000 were seized. This could potentially feed the addiction of about 1,040 abusers for a week.In the afternoon of 19 March, CNB officers raided a private residential unit near Cavenagh Road. Forced entry was effected as the occupant of the unit, a 26-year-old Singaporean man, refused to heed the lawful orders of the officers to be granted access into the unit. The suspect was arrested within one of the bedrooms. A search of the bedroom in which the suspect was arrested found about 6,885g of cannabis, 69g of Ice, 21g of ketamine, 20g of Ecstasy, six LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps and six bottles of GHB (gamma-hydroxybutyrate). A small amount of cannabis, ketamine and cash of SGD6,229.50 and small amounts of foreign currencies were also found on the suspect. About 25g of cannabis, 25g of psilocybin mushrooms, 17g of Ice and a small amount of ketamine were recovered from the suspects vehicle parked in the same residential compound. Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspect are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: , , ; During an islandwide operation from 10-14 March, CNB officers arrested a suspected drug abuser who was a mother of 3 young children. Two of her children, aged 12 and 14, were present when she was arrested at her residential unit. Some Ice and drug paraphernalia were recovered from the top of a cabinet in her bedroom. She had been abusing Ice at home and left the drug and drug paraphernalia openly in the bedroom which the children had access to. The children have since been placed in the care of their next-of-kin. The home should have been a place of safety for young children. This case is an unfortunate reminder that the harms of drugs extend beyond the abuser. The irresponsible actions of a parent can set a child on a dangerous path, one that could lead to a cycle of drug abuse and suffering. No child should be exposed to such dangers.Lets make a clear stand drugs have no place in our society.DrugFreeSG

caption: #: - - CNB arrested 76 suspected drug offenders in an island-wide anti-drug operation from 10 to 14 March 2025. Areas covered during the operation included Bukit Merah, Chai Chee, Tiong Bahru, Jurong and Yishun. A total of about 462g of heroin, 357g of Ice, 58g of cannabis, 11g of ketamine, 46g of Ecstasy and 76 Erimin-5 tablets, with an estimated worth of more than $97,800, were seized. In the morning of 11 March, a 30-year-old Singaporean man was arrested near Tampines Street 82 for suspected drug trafficking offences. He attempted to evade arrest by running away but was swiftly apprehended by CNB officers. He was escorted to his residential unit in the same vicinity where about 160g of Ice and 42g of Ecstasy were found. About 10g of Ice were recovered from him.In a separate operation on the same morning, a residential unit near Bishan Street 12 was raided, where a 28-year-old Singaporean man and a 41-year-old Singaporean woman were arrested for suspected drug trafficking offences. A search of the unit recovered about 430g of heroin, 28g of Ice, 14g of cannabis and 46 Erimin-5 tablets. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story.drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: ; CNB conducted two separate operations on 4 March, which saw a large amount of heroin and cannabis seized and the arrests of four Singaporean suspected drug traffickers. The drugs seized had an estimated worth of more than SGD619,000 and could potentially feed the addiction of about 2,630 abusers for a week.One of the locations was a hotel near Havelock Road, where CNB officers raided a room and arrested the two occupants, a 21-year-old woman and a 50-year-old man. About 340g of heroin, 103g of Ecstasy, 27g of Ice, five Erimin-5 tablets and cash of SGD9,180 and MYR711 were recovered from within the room. About 2,758g of heroin and 515g of Ice were later recovered from the suspects rented vehicle parked at the hotels carpark.The second operation took place at the carpark of a commercial property near Kaki Bukit Road 3, where CNB officers arrested a 27-year-old woman and a 33-year-old man. A search of the mans hideout a unit within the same building led to the recovery of about 4.99kg of cannabis, 279g of ketamine, 222g of Ice, 115g of Ecstasy, 250 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps and numerous vape devices, cartridges and edibles suspected to contain THC (tetrahydrocannabinol). Officers also recovered about 11g of Ice through a concurrent search conducted on the car driven by the female suspect.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: ; On 25 February 2025, CNB conducted an operation which saw the arrest of two Singaporean men and drugs worth more than SGD135,000, which could potentially feed the addiction of ~490 drug abusers for a week. In the late hours of 25 February, CNB officers arrested two men, who were standing next to a car, near Redhill Road. CNB officers escorted the 37-year-old man to his residential unit in the same vicinity and a search of the unit led to the recovery of about 1,890g of cannabis, 139g of ketamine, 102g of Ice, 69g of cocaine, 93g of Ecstasy, 408 Erimin-5 tablets, 188 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, 49 bottles of GHB (gamma-hydroxybutyrate) and 36 vape devices suspected to contain THC (tetrahydrocannabinol).Concurrently, in the presence of the other 44-year-old man, CNB officers searched the car driven by him. Officers recovered about 901g of cannabis, 50g of Ice, 16g of ketamine, 10g of Ecstasy, one Erimin-5 tablet and four vape devices suspected to contain THC from the car.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .

caption: CNBOnTheMove: -- - - CNB arrested 80 suspected drug offenders, the youngest being a 14-year-old girl, in an island-wide anti-drug operation from 10 to 14 February 2024. A total of about 916g of heroin, 426g of Ice, 82g of cannabis, 6g of ketamine, 234 Ecstasy tablets and 38 Erimin-45 tablets were seized. On 11 February, CNB officers raided a residential unit near Chin Swee Road and arrested a 61-year-old Singaporean man for suspected drug trafficking. A total of about 453g of heroin, 132g of Ice, 10g of cannabis, five Erimin-5 tablets and cash in various currencies amounting to SGD6,097.30, MYR75, IDR15,000 and VND20,000 were recovered.In the evening of 11 February, CNB officers arrested a suspected drug trafficker, a 39-year-old Singaporean man, at a residential block near Rivervale Crescent. A total of about 85g of Ice, 6g of ketamine, 14 Erimin-5 tablets, 232 Ecstasy tablets and cash amounting to SGD1,044 were recovered.On 13 February, CNB officers raided a residential unit near Tampines Central 7. Officers arrested a 28-year-old Singaporean man and recovered drug paraphernalia and plant parts believed to be parts of a cannabis plant. Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: ; . A 58-year-old Singaporean man was arrested for attempting to smuggle about 5,653g of heroin, 14g of Ice, 11g of Ecstasy and 2,000 Erimin-5 tablets, with a total estimated worth of SGD628,000 in a Singapore-registered car arriving at Woodlands Checkpoint. The recovered drugs could potentially feed the addiction of about 2,700 abusers for a week; cash of SGD48.60 and MYR1,640.90 were also seized. had directed the car for enhanced checks, where they uncovered 10 and five black bundles - suspected to contain controlled drugs - concealed under the drivers and front passenger seats respectively. The man was immediately placed under arrest and the case was handed over to CNB for further investigation.Under Section 7 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, those who import into or export from Singapore more than 15g of diamorphine or pure heroin may face the death penalty. Our borders are our first line of defence in safeguarding Singapores security. ICA and CNB will continue to work together to prevent attempts to smuggle drugs across our borders.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio
cleaned_caption: A 58-year-old Singaporean man was arrested for attempting to smuggle about 5,653g of heroin, 14g of Ice, 11g of Ecstasy and 2,000 Erimin-5 tablets, with a total estimated worth of SGD628,000 in a Singapore-registered car arriving at Woodlands Checkpoint. The recovered drugs could potentially feed the addiction of about 2,700 abusers for a week; cash of SGD48.60 and MYR1,640.90 were also seized. The authorities directed the car for enhanced checks, where they uncovered 10 and five black bundles - suspected to contain controlled drugs - concealed under the driver's and front passenger seats respectively. The man was immediately placed under arrest and the case was handed over to the Central Narcotics Bureau for further investigation. Under Section 7 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, those who import into or export from Singapore more than 15g of diamorphine or pure heroin may face the death penalty. Our borders are our first line of defence in safeguarding Singapore's security. ICA and CNB will continue to work together to prevent attempts to smuggle drugs across our borders. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: -- - - ; -- CNB arrested 116 suspected drug offenders in an island-wide anti-drug operation from 6 to 16 January 2025. The youngest arrested was a 14-year-old student suspected of drug abuse.A total of about 2.9kg of heroin, 1.2kg of Ice, 643g of ketamine, 262g of Ecstasy, 218g of cannabis, 419 Erimin-5 tablets, five bottles of methadone and a small amount of new psychoactive substances were seized, with an estimated street value of more than SGD550,000. On 7 January, an 18-year-old student was arrested in a residential unit near Bukit Batok Street 52 for suspected drug trafficking. Forced entry was made as the suspect refused to lawfully cooperate with CNB officers. A plastic packet containing about 500g of ketamine was recovered from the ground floor, which the suspect threw out from the kitchen window prior to the officers' entry into the unit. A follow-up operation saw the arrest of another suspected drug trafficker, a 34-year-old man, near Segar Road. His residential unit near Bangkit Road was searched and 19g of ketamine and 6g of Ecstasy was recovered from within the unit. Additionally, about 100g of ketamine was recovered from behind a trolley placed outside the unit, and 97g of Ecstasy and 24g of ketamine were recovered from his car. On 14 January, CNB officers raided a residential unit near Circuit Road, where a 60-year-old man suspected of drug trafficking was arrested. A search of the unit led to the recovery of about 536g of heroin and cash amounting to SGD40,466.20. [Continued in comments]

caption: CNBOnTheMove: . In the morning of 14 January 2025, foiled an attempt to smuggle about 4.6kg of cannabis, 542g of Ice and 250 Erimin-5 tablets in a Malaysia-registered motorcycle arriving at Woodlands Checkpoint. The drugs could potentially feed the addiction of about 970 abusers for a week and have an estimated worth of more than S$169,000.When ICA officers conducted further checks on the motorcycle ridden by a 21-year-old Malaysian man, they uncovered a black bundle from the front fairing of the motorcycle. CNB officers were immediately alerted to the detection for further checks, and seized the drugs found concealed at various parts of the motorcycle. Investigations are ongoing. Under Section 7 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, those who import into or export from Singapore more than 500g of cannabis or 250g of methamphetamine may face the death penalty.Our borders are our first line of defence in safeguarding Singapores security. ICA and CNB will continue to work together to prevent attempts to smuggle drugs across our borders. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: ; . .CNB conducted two separate operations on 9 January 2025, which saw the arrest of two men, both Singaporeans, and a large amount of drugs and cash seized. The drugs seized had an estimated worth more than SGD254,000 and could potentially feed the addiction of about 1,200 abusers for a week.The male suspect, aged 59, was arrested in a residential unit in the vicinity of Upper Cross Street. Forced entry was used as the suspect refused to heed the lawful orders of the officers to be granted access into the unit. About 1,965g of heroin, 118g of Ice, two bottles of methadone, various drug utensils and cash amounting to SGD32,378.26 and USD1 were recovered from within the unit. In a separate operation on the same morning, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Pasir Ris Street 71 and arrested a male suspect, aged 50, within the unit. A total of about 1,378g of cannabis, various drug utensils and cash in various currencies amounting to SGD7,594, MYR292, IDR3,786,000, SAR20 and EGP690 were recovered from within the unit.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: . $ ; CNB conducted an operation on 4 January 2025 which saw the seizure of drugs with a total estimated worth of more than $1 million, and the arrests of four Singaporean youths. The seized drugs could potentially feed the addiction of 4,590 drug abusers for a week. Two male suspects aged 27 and 25 were arrested at a carpark near Cassia Crescent, with about 1,855g of heroin, 1,032g of Ice, 98g of Ecstasy tablets and 300 Erimin-5 tablets found on the former, and about 136g of Ice and 21g of cannabis found on the latter. About 11.78kg of cannabis, 1,632g of heroin, 923g of Ice, 877g of ketamine, 234g of Ecstasy tablets and 1,200 Erimin-5 tablets were subsequently recovered from a car which they were arrested next to. The third male suspect (also aged 25), who fled the scene upon witnessing the arrests of the two men, was arrested following a short pursuit. An offensive weapon was seized from him and handed over to the Police.CNB officers recovered about 73g of Ice, 21g of heroin, 20 Erimin-5 tablets and a small amount of Ecstasy tablets upon raiding the 27-year-old suspects residential unit in the same vicinity. A 25-year-old female suspected drug abuser was arrested within the unit. DAC Aaron Tang, Director Intelligence Division, said: Drug traffickers have no concern for the thousands of lives that their deadly ware will destroy had the drugs went onto the streets. CNB has doubled down on our preventive drug education efforts to keep people away from drugs. We made it clear that drugs harm not just the individual but also their families and loved ones. For those who choose not to heed our warnings, CNB will relentlessly pursue them and bring them to justice.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: Suspected drug trafficker with knife, among 54 drug offenders arrested in island-wide op 54 suspected drug offenders were arrested in an island-wide operation conducted from 24 to 29 Nov, with the youngest being a 16-year-old Singaporean girl for suspected drug abuse. A total of about 2,430g of heroin, 64g of Ice, 723g of cannabis, 9g of ketamine, 38 Ecstasy tablets, 94 Erimin-5 tablets and 2,034 tablets of Tawon Liar believed to contain Tapentadol with an estimated street value of $286,000 - were seized. Locations covered during the operation included Bukit Batok, Hougang, Marsiling, Queenstown and Yishun.In the morning of 29 Nov, a residential unit in the central region of Singapore was raided, where a 60-year-old Singaporean man was seen holding a knife. The man was swiftly subdued by the officers to prevent injury to himself and those around him, and was arrested therein for suspected drug trafficking offences. Forced entry was effected as the man had refused to heed the lawful orders of the officers to open the door. About 2,395g of heroin, 722g of cannabis, 25g of Ice, 44 Erimin-5 tablets and two Ecstasy tablets - with estimated street value of about $273,000 - were seized from within the unit. The amount of heroin, cannabis and Ice seized from within the unit can feed the addiction of about 1,258 abusers for a week.DAC Chang Gim Fook, Deputy Director (Operations) of Intelligence Division, said: The operation on 29 November is an example of the dangers that CNB officers face every day. The suspect was holding a knife, and we had assessed that he could pose a danger to himself and to the officers. Drug traffickers may be armed, increasing the risk to our officers. But this will not deter us. CNB officers are well-trained to handle such situations and managed to safely and effectively subdue the suspect before anyone got hurt. The swift action of the team allowed us to disrupt the supply of illicit drugs that could otherwise pose great harm to Singapore.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: Last Thursday, we celebrated the invaluable contributions of our DrugFreeSG advocates and partners at the DrugFreeSG Appreciation Dinner, hosted by Assoc Prof Muhammad Faishal Ibrahim, Minister of State, Ministry of Home Affairs & Ministry of National Development. MOS Faishal announced the launch of CNBs rebranded volunteer scheme, the DrugFreeSG Advocacy Network at the event. This new unified scheme will empower our advocates with training opportunities and resources to help spread the anti-drug message in the community. If youre keen to find out more about being a DrugFreeSG Advocate, email us at CNB_Community_Partnership.gov.sg.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: ~$1.4 MILLION WORTH OF DRUGS SEIZED, ENOUGH TO FEED 6,200 DRUG ABUSERS FOR A WEEK On 7 November, CNB conducted an operation and seized a large amount of drugs, including heroin, cannabis and Ice. The drugs seized, estimated to be worth about $1.4 million, could feed the addiction of 6,200 drug abusers for a week. In the evening hours of 7 November, a 32-year-old man was arrested at the void deck of a residential block near Plantation Crescent while a residential unit of the same block was raided and a 44-year-old man and a 31-year-old woman within the unit were arrested. All three are Singaporeans. About 1,027g of cannabis and 513g of Ice were recovered from the 32-year-old man and a search of the unit led to the recovery of about 3,223g of cannabis, 7,626g of heroin, 2,339g of Ice, 235g of Ecstasy, five bottles of methadone, 2,590 Erimin-5 tablets and cash amounting to $9,250. A subsequent search of a car that was driven by the 44-year-old man found 95g of cannabis, 477g of heroin, 169g of Ice and three bottles of methadone.DAC Aaron Tang, Director of Intelligence Division, said: The efforts of the CNB officers in this operation had prevented a large haul of drugs from flowing into the streets, which if not stopped, would have impacted the lives of thousands of individuals. The harm and misery that drugs inflict on society is far-reaching. Drugs do not just affect an individual, it also destroys the lives of their families and loved ones. CNB will continue to hunt down these drug traffickers and neutralise them to stem the tide of drugs.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: - , $ 112 suspected drug offenders were arrested in an island-wide operation conducted from 14 to 25 October, with the youngest being a 16-year-old girl for suspected drug abuse. A total of about 1.7kg of Ice, 739g of heroin, 215g of cannabis, 16 Ecstasy tablets and six Erimin-5 tablets with an estimated total street value of $296,000 were seized. Locations covered during the operation included a residential unit near Bedok South Avenue 3, where a 42-year-old woman and a 44-year-old man were arrested on 14 October. A total of about 1.7kg of Ice, 69g of heroin and 17g of cannabis were recovered from within the unit.CNB officers raided two other residential units situated within the same block near Eunos Crescent on 16 October. One of the cases saw the arrest of a Singaporean husband-and-wife duo (aged 55 and 37 respectively) within the unit, where about 32g of Ice, seven grammes of heroin, six Erimin-5 tablets and some Ecstasy tablets were recovered. The couples children aged 10 and 12, who were found within the unit during the raid, have since been placed in the care of their next-of-kin. In the second case, officers effected forced entry after the occupants within a 25-year-old man and 31-year-old woman refused to comply with lawful orders to grant them access into the unit. Both suspects were arrested, and a small amount of heroin was recovered from within the unit.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: $, Four suspected drug offenders aged between 24 to 36 were arrested in two operations. The large haul of drugs seized could feed the addiction of about 1,310 drug abusers for a week.In the evening hours of 18 October, CNB officers intercepted a vehicle at the junction of Bedok North Avenue 3 and Bedok North Road and arrested the driver and passenger of the vehicle, a 36-year-old man and a 26-year-old woman respectively. Both are Singaporeans. A search of the car recovered about 531g of Ice among other drugs. In the evening hours of 19 October, CNB officers arrested a 32-year-old Malaysian man in his residential unit in the vicinity of Fernvale Street. A small amount of ketamine was found on the man. Following his arrest, a 24-year-old Singaporean man was also arrested on the ground floor of a residential block in the vicinity of Fernvale Link. CNB officers escorted the man to his residential unit in the same block and a search of the unit recovered about 6.2kg of cannabis, among other drugs and paraphernalia. Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act (MDA) 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 250g of methamphetamine, or more than 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: ; A 37-year-old Singapore man has been arrested by CNB on 20 October 2024 for suspected drug trafficking and other drug-related offences committed between 2014 and 2024. The man was first arrested and charged in court with three counts of drug trafficking and one count of drug consumption in 2014, but failed to attend court in 2017 after being released on bail an arrest warrant was then issued against him. He was also wanted by the Police to assist in investigations into two cases of voluntarily causing grievous hurt and cheating by impersonation. He was arrested by the Narcotics Crime Investigation Department (NCID) of the Royal Malaysian Police (RMP) for criminal and immigration offences on 1 October 2024, subsequently deported and handed over to CNB on 20 October 2024.In expressing appreciation to the NCID, SAC Leon Chan, Acting Director of CNB, said: CNB would like to thank NCID/RMP for their strong support in rendering assistance to CNB for this case. Drug traffickers thinking to evade our law by hiding overseas will find that there is no safe haven. The close cooperation between CNB and NCID/RMP and the eventual arrest of the man in this operation is testament to the strong working relationship that CNB has with them. We thank our Malaysian counterparts for the cooperation to bring the suspect back to Singapore to face the law.The man was brought to Court to face the original 2014 drug charges. CNB is also pursuing investigations into the other cases of drug trafficking.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

He was arrested by the Narcotics Crime Investigation Department (NCID) of the Royal Malaysian Police (RMP) for criminal and immigration offences on 1 October 2024, subsequently deported and handed over to CNB on 20 October 2024. In expressing appreciation to the NCID, the Acting Director of CNB said: CNB would like to thank NCID/RMP for their strong support in rendering assistance to CNB for this case. Drug traffickers thinking to evade our law by hiding overseas will find that there is no safe haven. The close cooperation between CNB and NCID/RMP and the eventual arrest of the man in this operation is testament to the strong working relationship that CNB has with them. We thank our Malaysian counterparts for the cooperation to bring the suspect back to Singapore to face the law. The man was brought to Court to face the original 2014 drug charges. CNB is also pursuing investigations into the other cases of drug trafficking.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 19-- Three Singaporean 19-year-old suspected drug offenders were arrested in an operation conducted by CNB on 18 September 2024. The drugs seized in this operation are worth about $78,000 and could potentially feed the addiction of 390 abusers for a week. In the early evening of 18 September, two 19-year-old suspects a man and a woman were arrested in a residential unit in Rivervale Walk. Various drug paraphernalia and a digital weighing scale were recovered within the bedroom of the 19-year-old man.The two suspects were then escorted to a private residential unit near Hougang Avenue 7, which was rented by the man. A search of the unit led to the recovery of about 486g of Ice and 695g of cannabis.In a follow-up operation, a residential unit in the vicinity of Serangoon North Avenue 3 was raided. Another 19-year-old man was arrested within a bedroom of the unit. A search of the bedroom led to the recovery of about 24g of Ice, various drug paraphernalia and cash amounting to $11,400. SAC Sng Chern Hong, Deputy Director CNB (Policy & Administration), said: Yet another CNB operation saw the arrest of teenagers and, this time, with a large amount of drugs that could potentially feed the addiction of about 390 abusers for a week. It is disheartening to see not just three young lives destroyed by drugs but also their families and loved ones becoming victims of drugs and drug abuse. We cannot but again emphasise, that parents need to join us in efforts to educate the young on the harms of drugs and its destructive effects on families and society. Lets start the conversation now, before it is too late. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

Let's start the conversation now, before it is too late. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: ; A 31-year-old Singaporean man has been arrested by CNB on 19 September 2024 for suspected drug trafficking.His involvement was uncovered during the course of CNBs investigation into two drug trafficking cases in December 2020 and November 2022. An arrest warrant was issued against him for his suspected involvement in supplying drugs to associates in Singapore for their subsequent trafficking and sale in Singapore. Immigration records showed that the man had been out of Singapore since 11 April 2016. CNB reached out to its foreign counterparts for information on his whereabouts.He was arrested by the Thai authorities on 17 September 2024, subsequently deported and handed over to CNB on 19 September 2024. In expressing appreciation to Thailands Office of the Narcotics Control Board, SAC Leon Chan, Acting Director of CNB, said: We thank our Thai counterparts for the close cooperation and swift action to bring the suspect back to Singapore to face the law. Drug syndicates exploit global interconnectivity to operate remotely, creating threats that extend far beyond borders and inflicting profound impacts on the safety and security of our local community. CNB will continue to collaborate closely with our foreign counterparts to track down drug syndicates and dismantle their networks no matter where they operate, and we will spare no efforts in bringing to justice those who choose to cause harm and profit from the suffering of others.He will be charged in court on 20 September 2024 for drug trafficking offences. Investigations into other members of the syndicate are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio
cleaned_caption: CNBOnTheMove: A 31-year-old Singaporean man has been arrested by CNB on 19 September 2024 for suspected drug trafficking. His involvement was uncovered during the course of CNB's investigation into two drug trafficking cases in December 2020 and November 2022. An arrest warrant was issued against him for his suspected involvement in supplying drugs to associates in Singapore for their subsequent trafficking and sale in Singapore. Immigration records showed that the man had been out of Singapore since 11 April 2016. CNB reached out to its foreign counterparts for information on his whereabouts. He was arrested by the Thai authorities on 17 September 2024, subsequently deported and handed over to CNB on 19 September 2024. caption: CNBOnTheMove: . $, On 17 September, CNB seized approximately 6.5kg of cannabis and a large assortment of other drugs in a major operation. Five Singaporean men, aged 19 to 39, were arrested for suspected drug trafficking. The seized drugs are worth about $333,000 and could potentially feed the addiction of 1,480 addicts for a week.In the morning of 17 September, a 26-year-old man was arrested in the carpark of a residential estate near Anchorvale Lane. About 32g of Ice was found on the man. A residential unit in the same estate was raided simultaneously, where four other men were arrested. About 6.15kg of cannabis, 777g of Ice, 281g of Ecstasy, 693 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps and 1,378 Erimin-5 tablets were recovered.One of the suspects, a 39-year-old man, was escorted to his car parked in the estate. A search of the car led to the recovery of about 375g of cannabis, 129g of Ice, 11g of Ecstasy and 51 Erimin-5 tablets.Three children aged 11, 13 and 15 were in the unit when it was raided. They have been placed in the care of their next-of-kin.Following the arrests at Anchorvale Lane, the official residential units of the five suspects were raided. About 19g of Ice, two LSD stamps and five Erimin-5 tablets were recovered at the residential unit of one of the suspects.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio
cleaned_caption:
On 17 September, the Central Narcotics Bureau (CNB) seized approximately 6.5kg of cannabis and a large assortment of other drugs in a major operation. Five Singaporean men, aged 19 to 39, were arrested for suspected drug trafficking. The seized drugs are worth about $333,000 and could potentially feed the addiction of 1,480 addicts for a week. 

In the morning of 17 September, a 26-year-old man was arrested in the carpark of a residential estate near Anchorvale Lane. About 32g of Ice was found on the man. A residential unit in the same estate was raided simultaneously, where four other men were arrested. About 6.15kg of cannabis, 777g of Ice, 281g of Ecstasy, 693 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, and 1,378 Erimin-5 tablets were recovered.

One of the suspects, a 39-year-old man, was escorted to his car parked in the estate. A search of the car led to the recovery of about 375g of cannabis, 129g of Ice, 11g of Ecstasy, and 51 Erimin-5 tablets. Three children aged 11, 13, and 15 were in the unit when it was raided. They have been placed in the care of their next-of-kin.

Following the arrests at Anchorvale Lane, the official residential units of the five suspects were raided. About 19g of Ice, two LSD stamps, and five Erimin-5 tablets were recovered at the residential unit of one of the suspects. Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 20-- 65 - - In an island-wide anti-drug operation carried out from 9 to 13 September 2024, 65 suspected drug offenders were arrested. The youngest arrested in this island-wide operation was a 20-year-old Singaporean man for suspected drug trafficking. A total of about 954g of heroin, 201g of Ice, 158g of cannabis amongst other drugs were seized.On 11 September, a 33-year-old Singaporean man was arrested for suspected drug trafficking at a residential unit in the vicinity of Bedok North Street 2. About 123g of cannabis and some drug paraphernalia were recovered. Following a separate lead later on 11 September, three Singaporeans aged 45, 51 and 55 were arrested for suspected drug trafficking. A total of about 896g of heroin and 146g of Ice, amongst other drugs were seized in this operation spanning Bedok and Upper Boon Keng. The drugs seized in this operation are estimated to be worth about $120,000 and would have fed the addiction of 510 drug abusers for a week.Assistant Commissioner Lim Fung Suan, Director of Enforcement, said of the operations:This island-wide operation saw a young person arrested for suspected drug trafficking. We cannot lower our guard on the youth drug situation. Youths must be continuously engaged on the harms of drugs and its detrimental effects on families and society. Parents need to pay close attention to the company their child keep, to avoid them mixing with the wrong company. Prevention is better than cure.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: $, ; Drugs worth an estimated $305,000, including about 3.14kg of cannabis, were seized in a CNB operation conducted on 9 September 2024. A 34-year-old Malaysian man was arrested for suspected drug trafficking. CNB officers arrested the man in the vicinity of Chin Swee Road on the night of 9 September. About 1.88kg of heroin, 3.14kg of cannabis, amongst other drugs were found in the search of the car the man was driving. The haul of drugs seized in this operation can feed the addiction of about 1,500 abusers for a week.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 15g of pure heroin (diamorphine) or 250g of methamphetamine or 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspect are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: ~$. -- - - 113 suspected drug offenders were arrested in an island-wide anti-drug operation from 12 to 23 Aug. The youngest arrested was a 15-year-old student. A total of about 9.8kg of heroin, 3.3kg of Ice, among other drugs were seized during the operation and the drugs have an estimated street value of about $1.54 million. Some of the areas covered during this operation included Bukit Timah, Ghim Moh, Hougang, Jurong, Marsiling, Mountbatten, Tampines. In the afternoon of 13 August, a 45-year-old Singaporean man was arrested with about 371g of Ice, 124g of cannabis, 30g of Ecstasy, 19g of ketamine and one Erimin-5 tablet. The largest heroin seizure yet for 2024 was seized on the evening of 14 August. A 67-year-old Singaporean man was arrested with about 9.5kg of heroin, 2.6kg of Ice, among other drugs and cash of $25,240.50. The estimated worth of the drugs seized in this case is about $1.4 million.On 19 August, a 15-year-old Singaporean boy was arrested for suspected drug abuse; he was arrested with a small amount of Ice. Follow-up investigations led to the arrest of another 15-year-old Singaporean boy for suspected drug trafficking. Both are students.Deputy Assistant Commissioner Saherly Bin Limat, Director of Enforcement, said of the operations:This island-wide operation saw the arrest of a 15-year-old suspected drug trafficker. This is a stark reminder to all, that we must not lower our attention on the teenage drug situation. We must continue to engage our youths on the topic of drugs and the harm drugs can cause. Parents have a key role to play in preventive drug education, lest they end up getting information via dubious channels and start sliding down the slippery slope of drugs. CNB has preventive drug education information online which parents can utilise to start their conversation with their children. The time to start engaging them is now, not later.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: - - ; 71 suspected drug offenders were arrested in an island-wide anti-drug operation from 10 to 14 June 2024. Some of the areas covered in this operation included Ang Mo Kio, Bedok, Bukit Batok and Toa Payoh. A total of about 555g of Ice, 406g of heroin, amongst other drugs were seized. During the raid, Ice and Erimin-5 tablets were recovered from the house and the ground floor rubbish chute of the block. caption: CNBOnTheMove: 4.5 & 968 '' ; 1,200 A large haul of drugs, including about 4.5kg of cannabis and 968g of Ice was seized by CNB on 4 June 2024. The drugs seized is estimated to be worth about $692,000 and can feed the addiction of about 1,200 abusers for a week.In the late hours of 4 June, a 38-year-old male driver and the passenger, a 27-year-old man, were arrested at a multi-storey carpark in the vicinity of Choa Chu Kang Street 51. Both are Singaporeans. A search of the car recovered about 4.5kg of cannabis, 968g of Ice, 63g of ketamine, 1,180 Erimin-5 tablets, 1,170g of Ecstasy and 181 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps. Both men were escorted to a riser nearby where another 50 Erimin-5 tablets were recovered.Two CNB officers sustained lacerations on their arms while effecting the arrest as the suspects had refused to comply with officers lawful request and resisted arrest violently. The two officers have since received outpatient treatment for their injuries.Deputy Assistant Commissioner Aaron Tang, Director of Intelligence Division, said: Drug traffickers only care about making as much profit as possible and will stop at nothing to get at that, even if it means causing harm to our society and inflicting injuries to CNB officers who are carrying out their duties. But this will not deter us from carrying out our mission to take them out. In fact, this will only strengthen our resolve for us to work even harder to disrupt their nefarious drug activities.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspect are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 5 & 1 ; $707A large haul of drugs, including about 5.8kg of cannabis and 1.582kg of Ice was seized by CNB on 18 May 2024. The cocktail of drugs seized in the operation is estimated to be worth more than $707,000 and can feed the addiction of 1,730 abusers for a week.In the afternoon of 18 May, a 32-year-old Singaporean man was arrested on the ground floor of a residential block located in the vicinity of Jurong West Street 81. CNB officers recovered about 756g of cannabis and 1.065kg of Ice, amongst other drugs and vape pods suspected to contain tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) from the mans bag. CNB officers then escorted the man to his rental car which was parked at a multi-storey carpark nearby and recovered about 517g of Ice and 5.052kg of cannabis from within the car.Deputy Assistant Commissioner Aaron Tang, Director Intelligence Division, said: The estimated worth of this large haul of drugs, nearly three-quarters of a million dollars, shows very clearly that drug traffickers only concern is to make as much profit as is possible, regardless of how many lives drugs may destroy, be it that of the abusers or their families and loved ones. Drug trafficking is all about profiting from the misery it inflicts on others. CNB will not let up on our efforts to neutralise drug trafficking activities and will continue to take out drug syndicates and traffickers so that they cannot inflict harm on the society.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 250g of methamphetamine or 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Investigations into the drug activities of the arrested suspect are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: - , ; $ 159 suspected drug offenders were arrested in an island-wide anti-drug operation conducted from 6 to 17 May 2024. A total of about 937g of heroin, 376g of Ice, 161g of cannabis, six grammes of ketamine, 102 Yaba tablets, 32 Ecstasy tablets, 22 Erimin-5 tablets, one LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamp, three bottles of liquid suspected to contain GHB (gamma hydroxybutyrate) and four pots of cannabis plants were seized. The drugs seized have an estimated street value of about $221,000.Locations covered included a residential unit near Fernvale Road, where a Singaporean father-son duo (aged 52 and 14) was arrested for suspected drug trafficking and drug consumption respectively on 6 May, and small amounts of Ice, heroin, and various drug paraphernalia were found. Preliminary investigations found that the man had ever given drugs to his son.Officers also raided the residential unit of a 39-year-old female suspected drug abuser on 7 May, where her one-year-old toddler was found. The toddler has since been placed under the care of a close-relative of the suspect.On 16 May, an 18-year-old Singaporean man was arrested in a residential unit near Yishun Avenue 3, where a pot of cannabis plant, three pots containing dried-up remnants of cannabis plants, various drug paraphernalia and plant cultivation paraphernalia including soil and organic compost were recovered. Preliminary investigations revealed that the man had been attempting to cultivate cannabis plants for about a month.<continued below>Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio
cleaned_caption: 159 suspected drug offenders were arrested in an island-wide anti-drug operation conducted from 6 to 17 May 2024. A total of about 937g of heroin, 376g of Ice, 161g of cannabis, six grammes of ketamine, 102 Yaba tablets, 32 Ecstasy tablets, 22 Erimin-5 tablets, one LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamp, three bottles of liquid suspected to contain GHB (gamma hydroxybutyrate) and four pots of cannabis plants were seized. The drugs seized have an estimated street value of about $221,000. Locations covered included a residential unit near Fernvale Road, where a father-son duo (aged 52 and 14) was arrested for suspected drug trafficking and drug consumption respectively on 6 May, and small amounts of Ice, heroin, and various drug paraphernalia were found. Preliminary investigations found that the man had ever given drugs to his son. Officers also raided the residential unit of a 39-year-old female suspected drug abuser on 7 May, where her one-year-old toddler was found. The toddler has since been placed under the care of a close relative of the suspect. On 16 May, an 18-year-old man was arrested in a residential unit near Yishun Avenue 3, where a pot of cannabis plant, three pots containing dried-up remnants of cannabis plants, various drug paraphernalia and plant cultivation paraphernalia including soil and organic compost were recovered. Preliminary investigations revealed that the man had been attempting to cultivate cannabis plants for about a month. Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: -- , - - An island-wide anti-drug operation was carried out from 21 to 26 April 2024. A 16-year-old female Singaporean was amongst the 67 suspected drug offenders arrested. About 572g of cannabis and 222g of heroin, amongst other drugs were seized. These drugs have an estimated street value of $62,000. On 21 April, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Bukit Batok West Avenue 4 and arrested a 50-year-old Singaporean man for suspected drug trafficking. From a search of the unit and his rental car parked nearby, officers recovered cash amounting to $9,081, as well as various types of drugs and drug paraphernalia. On 23 April, a 46-year-old Singaporean man was arrested in a residential unit in the vicinity of Corporation Drive for suspected drug trafficking. Various drug paraphernalia and drugs including 314g of cannabis and a whole cannabis leaf were found within the unit. Assistant Commissioner Sng Chern Hong, Deputy Director CNB (Policy & Administration), said:Possession of any part of the cannabis plant is an offence. Under the Misuse of Drugs Act, cannabis means any part of a plant of the genus Cannabis, or any part of such plant, by whatever name it is called. CNB would like to caution members of the public, that they should not purchase and keep any such part or parts of cannabis plants as it will be an offence under the law.Under Section 8(a) of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person to have in his or her possession any part of a plant of the genus Cannabis. If a person is found guilty of possession of cannabis where the quantity is less than 330g, he or she may be sentenced to a maximum of 10 years imprisonment or $20,000 fine or both.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: . - ; 64 suspected drug offenders were arrested in island-wide anti-drug operations conducted from 18 to 22 March. A total of about 11,467g of cannabis, 1,336g of Ice, 10g of ketamine, six grammes of heroin, three tablets and 82g of Ecstasy, 3,818 Erimin-5 tablets, 46 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, 19 bottles of liquid suspected to contain GHB (gamma-hydroxybutyrate) and 10 bottles of methadone, with an estimated street value of about $555,000, were seized.The seizure of about 11,467g of cannabis and 1,336g of Ice can feed the addiction of about 2,400 abusers for a week.Locations included a residential unit near Compassvale Walk, where four Singaporean teenagers aged between 17 and 19 were arrested on 18 March. About 16g of Ice, a digital weighing scale, numerous empty plastic packets and other drug paraphernalia were recovered from within the bedroom of one of the suspects, an 18-year-old student. Preliminary investigations found that the 18-year-old was involved in suspected drug trafficking activities and was assisted by the two 19-year-old suspects.In another case, on 21 March, CNB officers intercepted a car along Yishun Avenue 2 and arrested two male suspects: the driver aged 40, and the passenger aged 32. About 9,991g of cannabis, 1,126g of Ice, 10g of ketamine, 82g of Ecstasy, 46 LSD stamps and 3,812 Erimin-5 tablets were recovered from the car. Officers further recovered about 66g of Ice, 2 Erimin-5 tablets and 0.25g of Ecstasy from the 32-year-old mans residential unit near Sembawang Close, and 1,476g of cannabis and 19 bottles of liquid suspected to contain GHB from the 40-year-old mans residential unit near Woodlands Street 81. <continued below>Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: Attending the UN Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) forum with youths from other countries reminded me that we are not alone in the fight for a drug-free world. Megan, youth Anti-Drug Advocate (ADA) Did you know that the UNODC organises a Youth Forum every year? Megan, our youth ADA joined the forum held in Vienna this month! She represented Singapore at the forum where a total of 35 participants from 27 different countries attended. Participants attended activities such as learning sessions on evidence-based harm prevention methods and even attended a side event from this years session of the Commission on Narcotic Drugs (CND). The CND is the UNs main drug policymaking body where members meet to review and analyse the global drug situation and recommend measures to address the world drug problem.We are sure that the forum was an engaging one! Thank you, Megan, for representing Singapore.

The CND is the UN's main drug policymaking body where members meet to review and analyse the global drug situation and recommend measures to address the world drug problem. We are sure that the forum was an engaging one! Thank you to our youth ADA for representing Singapore.

caption: #: ; . During two separate operations conducted on 5 March, CNB arrested two Singaporean men for suspected drug trafficking offences. A total of 5,651g of cannabis, 975g of heroin, 195g of Ice, 10 Erimin-5 tablets and two bottles of methadone were seized. The cannabis, heroin and Ice seized can feed the addiction of about 1,380 abusers for a week.One operation saw the arrest of a 54-year-old man within a residential unit near Yishun Street 44, where officers recovered about 975g of heroin, 195g of Ice, 104g of cannabis, 10 Erimin-5 tablets and two bottles of methadone, estimated to be worth about $167,000. The other operation was conducted at a residential unit near Fernvale Street, where a 29-year-old man was arrested. Officers searched the room occupied by the suspect and recovered about 5,547g of cannabis with an estimated worth of $199,700, and cash amounting to $14,850.Deputy Assistant Commissioner Aaron Tang, Director of Intelligence Division, said of the operations: The two operations netted a large amount of drugs which could have flowed onto the streets feeding the addiction of a large number of drug abusers and luring new abusers into the downward spiral of drug abuse. Drug abuse is not victimless. Oftentimes, other than the abusers themselves, there are other victims, including their families and loved ones, who have to bear the destructive effects of drug abuse while drug syndicates profit off their misery. CNB is committed to keeping up the pressure against drug syndicates and traffickers and will continue to target them to prevent harm to individuals and society.Investigations into the drug activities of both suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

The cannabis, heroin and Ice seized can feed the addiction of about 1,380 abusers for a week. The other operation was conducted at a residential unit near Fernvale Street, where a 29-year-old man was arrested. Officers searched the room occupied by the suspect and recovered about 5,547g of cannabis with an estimated worth of $199,700, and cash amounting to $14,850. Deputy Assistant Commissioner, Director of Intelligence Division, said of the operations: The two operations netted a large amount of drugs which could have flowed onto the streets feeding the addiction of a large number of drug abusers and luring new abusers into the downward spiral of drug abuse. Drug abuse is not victimless. Oftentimes, other than the abusers themselves, there are other victims, including their families and loved ones, who have to bear the destructive effects of drug abuse while drug syndicates profit off their misery. CNB is committed to keeping up the pressure against drug syndicates and traffickers and will continue to target them to prevent harm to individuals and society. Investigations into the drug activities of both suspects are ongoing.

caption: #: -- ; - CNB had arrested 119 suspected drug offenders in an island-wide anti-drug operation conducted from 19 to 29 February. About 1,900g of heroin, 390g of Ice, 453g of cannabis, 8g of ketamine, 2g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), 82 Ecstasy tablets, two Erimin-5 tablets, nine LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps and 1g of cocaine, with a total estimated street value of about $343,000, were seized. The youngest arrested was an 18-year-old female drug trafficker.Locations covered included a residential unit near Clementi Avenue 4, where two Singaporean male drug abusers aged 19 and 21 were arrested on 19 February. While CNB officers were conducting a search in the master bedroom, the 19-year-old had charged towards a CNB female officer with a knife from his hiding spot behind the curtains. CNB officers swiftly unarmed the assailant, subdued him and placed him under arrest. He was referred to Police for further investigation for criminal intimidation while CNB continues investigations into his drug offences.On 21 February, four Singaporean males aged between 58 and 69 were arrested at a residential unit near Clementi Avenue 2 for suspected drug trafficking offences. A total of about 1,788 heroin, 19g of Ice and various drug paraphernalia within the unit and strewn (out of the bedroom window) at the foot of the residential block were recovered and seized.[continued in caption below]

caption: CNBOnTheMove: -- Central Narcotics Bureau (CNB) arrested three student drug abusers on 6 February 2024. All three had admitted to abusing drugs together on some occasions. The arrest of these student drug abusers highlights a key finding from the Institute of Mental Healths 2022 Health and Lifestyle Survey, specifically that the mean age of onset of drug abuse was 15.9 years of age, while 41.8% of those who abused drugs started before the age of 18.In the early hours of 6 February, CNB officers visited the residence of a 14-year-old girl and arrested her therein for suspected drug abuse. A stained packet was recovered from a search of her room. Preliminary investigations found that the 14-year-old started abusing Ice when she was 13. In addition, a week before her arrest, which was also the last occasion she abused Ice, she abused the drug at home with two other female friends.CNB officers proceeded to arrest the two other girls, both 13 years of age, at their residences. Preliminary investigations found that the two 13-year-old girls had, on occasions, abused Ice at the home of the 14-year-old. One of the 13-year-old had decided to participate in abusing drugs out of curiosity when she saw the other two girls doing so. These preliminary findings further echo the findings of IMHs 2022 Health and Lifestyle Survey, which found that residences ones own home or a friends home were the most commonly cited locations for drug consumption and that curiosity was one of the more often cited reasons for drug abuse.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

The arrest of these student drug abusers highlights a key finding from the Institute of Mental Health's 2022 Health and Lifestyle Survey, specifically that the mean age of onset of drug abuse was 15.9 years of age, while 41.8% of those who abused drugs started before the age of 18. In the early hours of 6 February, CNB officers visited the residence of a 14-year-old girl and arrested her therein for suspected drug abuse. A stained packet was recovered from a search of her room. Preliminary investigations found that the 14-year-old started abusing Ice when she was 13. In addition, a week before her arrest, which was also the last occasion she abused Ice, she abused the drug at home with two other female friends. CNB officers proceeded to arrest the two other girls, both 13 years of age, at their residences. Preliminary investigations found that the two 13-year-old girls had, on occasions, abused Ice at the home of the 14-year-old. One of the 13-year-olds had decided to participate in abusing drugs out of curiosity when she saw the other two girls doing so. These preliminary findings further echo the findings of IMH's 2022 Health and Lifestyle Survey, which found that residences, one's own home or a friend's home, were the most commonly cited locations for drug consumption and that curiosity was one of the more often cited reasons for drug abuse. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: ; $100 On 29 Jan 2024, Central Narcotics Bureau (CNB) officers mounted two separate operations and arrested two men and a woman, all Singaporeans, for suspected drug trafficking offences. About 2.6kg of cannabis, 346 tablets and 498g Ecstasy, 842g of Ice, amongst other drugs were seized. The seizure of about 2.6kg of cannabis and 842g of Ice can feed the addiction of about 850 abusers for a week.CAR INTERCEPTION ALONG HAVELOCK ROADIn the late afternoon of 29 January, CNB officers intercepted a car along Havelock Road and arrested the driver of the car, a 35-year-old man for suspected drug trafficking offences. A search of the car recovered about 955g of cannabis and 138g of Ice amongst other drugs. The haul of drugs recovered from the car is estimated to be worth about $118,000.RAID AT BEDOK RESERVOIR ROADIn another operation in the same afternoon, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Bedok Reservoir Road and arrested a 35-year-old man and a 23-year-old woman within the unit. A search of the unit recovered about 1.6kg of cannabis and 704g of Ice amongst other drugs. The drugs recovered from within the unit is estimated to be worth about $352,000.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1973, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 250g of methamphetamine or 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 15-- 68 ; $63 CNB arrested 68 suspected drug offenders in an island-wide anti-drug operation conducted from 21 to 26 January 2024, among which the youngest suspect arrested was a 15-year-old local student. A total of about 144g of heroin, 112g of Ice and 348g of cannabis, amongst other drugs with an estimated street value of about $63,000, were seized.One of the areas covered included a void deck of a residential block near Bedok North Street 3, where CNB officers arrested a 59-year-old Singaporean man for suspected drug trafficking offences on 25 January. The suspect had put up a violent struggle, and necessary force was used to subdue him. About 109g of heroin, 32g of Ice, two Ecstasy tablets and various drug paraphernalia were recovered.Four other Singaporeans were arrested for suspected drug offences. Forced entry was effected during the arrest of a 32-year-old Singaporean man and a 19-year-old Singaporean woman at a residential unit near Ang Mo Kio Avenue 3 on 21 January, as the occupant had refused to comply with the lawful orders of the officers to open the door. About 154g of cannabis and 5g of Ice amongst other drugs and various drug paraphernalia were seized. In a separate case, CNB officers, acting on information received, raided a residential unit near Pasir Ris Drive 4 on 23 January, and arrested a Singaporean couple, a 42-year-old suspected drug trafficker and his wife for suspected drug offences therein. Officers recovered cannabis, Ice and various drug paraphernalia from within the unit, and from the womans belongings.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 71 - - 19 24 A total of 71 suspects arrested and about 881g of heroin, 193g of Ice, amongst other drugs and cash amounting to $22,580.15 were seized from the island-wide operation from 19-24 November. The drugs have an estimated street value of about $157,000. The youngest arrested was an 18-year-old suspected male drug offender. Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation included Ang Mo Kio, Bukit Batok, Kallang and Punggol. A 24-year-old Singaporean man was arrested for suspected drug offences in the vicinity of Pasir Ris Street 11. In the evening of 19 November, during the course of operation, CNB officers spotted the man climbing out of a window of a residential unit located on the second floor in a bid to evade arrest. The man was eventually arrested on the ground level and escorted to his residential unit where about 11g of Ice, various drug paraphernalia, a knuckle duster and a Karambit knife were recovered. Two Singaporeans were arrested for suspected drug trafficking offences on 20 November 2023. In an operation conducted in the morning of 20 November in the vicinity of Redhill Close, a 64-year-old Singaporean man was arrested. About 81g of heroin, 13g of Ice and cash amounting to $22,580.15 were seized. In another operation conducted later in the afternoon, a 52-year-old Singaporean man was arrested in his hideout located in the vicinity of Champions Way. About 679g of heroin and 95g of Ice were seized. Forced entry was effected in both operations as both men refused to comply with the lawful orders of the officers to open their doors. Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: CNBOnTheMove: ; 5.4 Five youths aged between 19 and 23, were arrested for suspected drug offences in an anti-drug operation conducted on 1 November 2023. A total of about 5.4 kg of cannabis, 751g of Ice, 63g of heroin amongst other drugs were seized. The drugs have an estimated street value of $507,000. The seizure of cannabis, Ice and heroin can feed the addiction of about 1,240 abusers for a week.In the first phase of the operation, a 21-year-old Singaporean woman was arrested for suspected drug offences in a residential unit in the vicinity of Buangkok Crescent on 1 November. Almost 2.3kg of cannabis, 216g of Ice, 63g of heroin and other drugs were recovered. Forced entry was effected as the suspect had refused to comply with the lawful orders of the officers to open the door. A 19-year-old Singaporean teenage boy and two foreign men, aged 20 and 21, were arrested in the vicinity of Duchess Avenue in a follow-up operation.In the second phase of the operation, a 23-year-old Singaporean man was arrested in a residential unit in the vicinity of Petir Road. Forced entry was effected as the suspect had refused to comply with the lawful orders of the officers to open the door. The suspect was escorted to a car and close to 3.2kg of cannabis, 535g of Ice, and other drugs were seized. DAC Chang Gim Fook, Deputy Director of Intelligence Division, said of the operations:Yesterdays anti-drug operations saw large seizures of cannabis and other controlled drugs, and the arrests of young drug offenders. Drugs are highly addictive, can destroy lives and tear families apart, but syndicates have no qualms in getting young people addicted to drugs and involved in serious drug offences. CNB is committed to keeping up the pressure against drug syndicates and traffickers and will continue to target them to prevent harm to individuals and society.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing. Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: - ; . From 3 to 10 October, CNB conducted a series of island-wide anti-drug operations targeted at drug transactions conducted through chat applications, and arrested 47 suspected drug traffickers and abusers. A total of about 5,500g of cannabis, 286g of Ice, 226g and 21 Ecstasy tablets, 2g of ketamine, 291 Erimin-5 tablets, 104 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, and 544g of powdery substance believed to be controlled drugs, with an estimated value of about $335,000, were seized. The seizure of 5,500g of cannabis and 286g of Ice can feed the addiction of about 950 abusers for a week.Forced entry had to be effected at a residential unit near Spooner Road, as the 36-year-old suspect had refused entry to officers. About 910g of cannabis, 207g of Ice, 28 Erimin-5 tablets, 21 Ecstasy tablets and 544g of powdery substances believed to be controlled drugs were seized.A pair of brothers aged 23 and 18 were arrested for suspected drug trafficking offences near Changi Road and within a private residence near Kew Drive respectively. 3,400g of cannabis, 165g of Ecstasy, 263 Erimin-5 tablets and 103 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps were seized from the private residence. The 23-year-old man was subsequently escorted to his car parked along Jalan Wakaff, where about 780g of cannabis and 61g of Ecstasy were seized.Other areas included a residential unit near Bukit Panjang Ring Road, where a 37-year-old man was arrested for suspected drug offences. 77g of cannabis and drug paraphernalia were recovered from within the unit and his car in a nearby carpark.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio

caption: #: ; . In the evening of 5 October, the Central Narcotics Bureau arrested three individuals, aged between 31 and 57, for suspected drug trafficking offences. A 47-year-old Singaporean man was arrested at a void deck of a residential block in the vicinity of Bedok North Street 3 for suspected drug trafficking offences. He was escorted to a residential unit of a nearby residential block located in the same vicinity, where officers subsequently arrested a 57-year-old Singaporean man and 31-year-old foreign woman for suspected drug trafficking offences. About 2,464g of heroin, with an estimated value of more than $259,000, and drug paraphernalia were seized from various locations within the unit. The seizure of 2,464g of heroin can feed the addiction of about 1170 abusers for a week.Investigations into all arrested suspects are ongoing.Full story .drugfreesg linkinbio
