caption: #: 93 - During the operations that took place from 27 Feb to 4 Mar, controlled drugs of more than 1kg of heroin, and others were seized. These drugs have an estimated street value of about $78,000.Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation included Bedok, Tampines and Toa Payoh.In one of the cases, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Circuit Road, and arrested two men aged 40 and 51 for suspected drug offences in the late evening of 27 Feb. As officers moved in to arrest the 51-year-old man, he put up a violent struggle and necessary force was used to subdue him. A knife was also later recovered from the 40-year-old man. About 3g of heroin and 2g of Ice were seized from the 51-year-old man. Another 946g of heroin and various drug paraphernalia were seized in another residential unit that the 51-year-old man was escorted to.In another case on 28 Feb in the vicinity of Clementi Ave 3, 8 persons were arrested including a 71-year-old man and his 49-year-old daughter. The father and daughter pair were arrested for suspected drug consumption. SUPT Mohd Hamzah Yusop, Director of Enforcement Division Sector 1, said of the island-wide ops : Drug offenders who think they can evade from the enforcement actions of CNB are mistaken. Our officers have worked hard during the week-long operation, and we will continue to launch timely and co-ordinated operations to keep our community safe and drug-free.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 15g of pure heroin (diamorphine), he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.Read more here:

caption: Meet CNB officer SSI Che Yahya Bin Mohd Bujang and his fellow (DIH) colleagues! SSI Yahya joined CNB in 1987. Over the last 35 years, he has chalked up a wealth of experience in the Enforcement, Supervision and Intelligence Divisions of CNB.He was also part of the pioneering team at CNBs Community Engagement Unit. SSI Yahya was closely involved in the launch of the DIH campaign in 2017. Together with other CNB officers and the community, they travelled around to rally the community, going the extra mile to support DIH volunteers in spreading the anti-drug message. Despite restrictions brought about by Covid-19, his team persevered with online sessions to sustain the engagement. For his significant contributions, commitment and dedication, SSI Yahya received the Efficiency Medal at the recent National Day Investiture held for MHA officers. Congratulations, SSI Yahya!SingaporeansAgainstDrugs SGAD DrugFreeSG DadahItuHaram

Despite restrictions brought about by Covid-19, his team persevered with online sessions to sustain the engagement. Congratulations, SSI! #SingaporeansAgainstDrugs #SGAD #DrugFreeSG #DadahItuHaram

caption: #: , $ , . On 25 February 2022, CNB officers raided a residential unit in a private residential enclave in the vicinity of Upper Serangoon Road and arrested three men for suspected drug activities. Large quantities of cannabis, Ice, heroin, cocaine and other drugs with a total estimated street value of $726,000 were found in the unit. Investigations into the suspects drug activities, including an investigation into their financial activities to trace and forfeit proceeds and property from the drug activities, are ongoing.AC Leon Chan, Deputy Director of Central Narcotics Bureau (Operations), said of the operation:Drug syndicates and traffickers are motivated by greed and will capitalise on the addiction and misery of drug abusers for profit. To them, drug abusers are revenue streams to cultivate and exploit, and they do not care that their actions are at the expense of innocent others such as the children or loved ones of the drug abusers. My officers remain committed to the mission of keeping Singapore drug-free, and will continue to clamp down on these illicit drug activities.Full News Release:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: ; -- Central Narcotics Bureau (CNB) officers arrested three men for suspected drug activities on 21 February 2022. A total of about 5,268g of cannabis and 11g of Ice, with a total estimated street value of $160,000, were seized during the operation. The seizure of 5,268g of cannabis can feed the addiction of about 750 abusers for a week.Under Section 5 of the Misuse of Drugs Act, it is an offence for a person, on his or her own behalf, or on behalf of any other person, whether or not that other person is in Singapore, to traffic in a controlled drug, offer to traffic in a controlled drug; or to do or offer to do any act preparatory to or for the purpose of trafficking in a controlled drug. If a person is found guilty of trafficking more than 500g of cannabis, he or she may face the mandatory death penalty.Full story: go.gov.sg/three-men-arrested-more-than-5kg-of-cannabis-seized

caption: CNBOnTheMove: The Health Sciences Authority (HSA) seized nearly $700,000 worth of e-vaporisers and components found during a CNB anti-drug operation on 16 February 2022. Drugs including Ice, Ecstasy tablets and drug paraphernalia were also seized during the operation, and three men in their 30s have been arrested for suspected drug offences.Members of the public who have information on the illegal import, distribution, sale or offer for sale of e-vaporisers can submit a report to HSA at Alternatively, they can contact HSAs Tobacco Regulation Branch at Tel: 6684 2036 or 6684 2037InTheNews:

caption: #: , On 28 and 29 Janurary 2022, a total of about 3.8kg of Ice, 1.8kg of cannabis, as well as Ecstasy tablets and other illicit drugs with a total estimated street value of $768,000 were seized during a CNB operation. Three men aged 38, 48 and 58 were arrested.A suspected drug store in an industrial building, where drugs were hidden in packages of coffee beans, was also uncovered. Large quantites of drugs were also found in the residence of one of the suspects.Drug producers in the region are producing more drugs. Those intending to import and traffic these illegal drugs here into Singapore and intending to bring harm to our community will be dealt with by the law. My officers will be thorough in bringing those involved in this case to justice. - AC Leon Chan, Deputy Director of CNB The seizure of 3,862g of Ice can feed the addiction of about 2,210 abusers for a week, while 1,873g of cannabis is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 270 abusers for a week.Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing. Read more here:

Large quantities of drugs were also found in the residence of one of the suspects. Drug producers in the region are producing more drugs. The seizure of 3,862g of Ice can feed the addiction of about 2,210 abusers for a week, while 1,873g of cannabis is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 270 abusers for a week. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.

cleaned_caption: On 28 and 29 January 2022, a total of about 3.8kg of Ice, 1.8kg of cannabis, as well as Ecstasy tablets and other illicit drugs with a total estimated street value of $768,000 were seized during a CNB operation. Three men aged 38, 48 and 58 were arrested. A suspected drug store in an industrial building, where drugs were hidden in packages of coffee beans, was also uncovered. Large quantities of drugs were also found in the residence of one of the suspects. Drug producers in the region are producing more drugs. Those intending to import and traffic these illegal drugs here into Singapore and intending to bring harm to our community will be dealt with by the law. My officers will be thorough in bringing those involved in this case to justice. The seizure of 3,862g of Ice can feed the addiction of about 2,210 abusers for a week, while 1,873g of cannabis is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 270 abusers for a week. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing.

caption: #: - On 20 Jan 2022, ICA officers foiled an attempt to smuggle about 7g of cannabis and cannabis products in a parcel declared to be cosmetic products. The products were sweets believed to have been infused with cannabis, and vaporisers containing cannabis extracts. CNB officers conducted a follow-up operation the same day and a 24-year-old Singaporean woman was arrested in the vicinity of Upper East Coast Road for suspected drug-related offences. 24 LSD stamps and two vaporisers containing cannabis extracts were further seized. Investigations are ongoing. Cannabis is a Class A controlled drug listed under Singapores Misuse of Drugs Act (MDA) in Singapore. The consumption, possession, trafficking, import or export of any controlled drugs, including cannabis and cannabis products, is an offence under the MDA. CNB would like to urge parents to play an active part to protect our youths from the menace of drugs, and to remind their children that they should not consume products unknown to them or offered by strangers. To entice youths to consume these products and to become addicted to them, these products are often disguised or marketed as candy or other food products, and sold in bright packaging designed to appeal to children and youths. Members of the public are advised to contact the CNB hotline at 1800-325-6666 for advice and assistance if they come across such illicit food products, or are worried that their children may be involved with drugs. Those who have drug-related information can make a report to CNB by calling 1800-325-6666 or at more:

caption: 100 , 8 In a recent island-wide operation, CNB officers seized a large quantity of drugs, including about 5,640g of heroin, 1,744g of Ice, 1,308g of cannabis, 5g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), 24 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, more than 3,000 Ecstasy tablets, 654 Erimin-5 tablets, and three bottles of methadone. 100 suspected drug offenders were also arrested.CNB officers will continue to keep a close watch on the ground for drug activities and continue with our robust enforcement to deter drug traffickers and take them off our streets. Our laws are tough and well known. Anyone who chooses to harm others by selling and trafficking drugs know the serious consequences that their actions will bring. - AC Leon Chan, Deputy Director of CNB The total amount of drugs seized in the operation is sufficient to feed 2,690 heroin abusers, 1,000 Ice abusers and 190 cannabis abusers for a week. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing. CNBOnTheMoveRead more here:

caption: ' ' , On 5 Jan 2022, CNB officers arrested five Singaporeans, comprising four men aged between 61 and 65, and a 65-year-old woman, for suspected drug trafficking activities. A total of about 932g of heroin and 5g of Ice, worth an estimated $66,000 on the street, were seized during the operation. Most of the drugs seized during the operation were found in coffee packets recovered from a toilet bowl at a residential unit in the vicinity of North Bridge Road, as well as from a rubbish chute nearby.A quantity of 932g of heroin can feed the addiction of about 440 abusers for a week. Investigations are ongoing. Full Story: DrugFreeSG

caption: CNBOnTheMove: On 3 January 2022, Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA) officers foiled an attempt to smuggle 5.8kg of kratom leaves in an arriving Malaysia-registered lorry via the Woodlands Checkpoint. This prompted subsequent enforcement operations by CNB. A total of five male suspects (a 33-year-old Singaporean and four Malaysians aged between 27 and 40), were arrested at multiple locations in Singapore over 3 and 4 January.Kratom contains Mitragynine and 7-Hydroxymitragynine, which are both Class A controlled drugs under the Misuse of Drugs Act. Investigations into the drug activities and suspects are ongoing. Read more here:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: , 2 In a recent op, CNB officers arrested two men aged 37 and 59 for suspected illegal drug activities. A total of about 1,867g of heroin, 216g of Ice, 68 Ecstasy tablets and 12 Erimin-5 tablets, worth a total estimated street value of $167,000, were also seized. Superintendent Lim Sze Yuk, Commanding Officer of Enforcement G Division, said: Illicit drugs are harmful, addictive, and can destroy lives, families and communities. This is why we have strict laws in Singapore against the trafficking, possession, consumption, and import or export of illicit drugs. CNB officers will continue to take rigorous enforcement and launch well-timed operations to keep the streets of Singapore safe from drug traffickers and syndicates. Investigations into the drug activities of all arrested suspects are ongoing. 1.8kg of heroin can feed the addiction of about 890 abusers for a week, while 216g of Ice is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 120 abusers for a week.DrugFreeSGRead more here:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: -- - In a 3-day island-wide drug operation from 8 to 10 December 2021, CNB arrested 63 suspected drug offenders. The youngest arrested is a 17-year-old male Singaporean suspected drug abuser. The total drugs seized are about 209g of heroin, 299g of Ice, 733g of cannabis, 10g of ketamine, 9g of NPS, one LSD stamp, one Erimin-5 tablet, and two bottles of liquid suspected to contain GHB. The drugs have an estimated street value of more than $70,500.During the search in the drug raid around the vicinity of Ang Mo Kio Street 22, CNB seized 12 packets and 107 straws containing 195g of heroin (see Photo). DrugFreeSG Read more here:

caption: -? - Chat apps like Telegram are fun ways to connect with lots of people. But drug syndicates and suppliers have been using such platforms to seek out new clients and reconnect with existing ones, thinking such apps will allow them to evade the law. This time, 50 suspected drug offenders have been arrested, including a 20-year old Singaporean male. Investigations are ongoing. This is a reminder that we've been watching and taking action. Just stay away from drugs. Full Story here: DrugFreeSG

caption: ' : ; - Acting on information provided by CNB, the Narcotics Crime Investigation Department (NCID) of the Royal Malaysian Police (RMP) arrested five Malaysians for suspected drug trafficking activities in and around Kuala Lumpur and Selangor. The drugs had an estimated street value of RM 4.9 million. Monitored by CNB since July 2021, the Malaysian-based syndicate was believed to have been trafficking drugs using Singapore-based freight forwarding companies, as legitimate forwarding agents, to deliver parcels which contain concealed drugs to other countries through Singapore. The swift arrest was the result of the strong collaboration between CNB & NCID, RMP. CNB will continue to maintain close international cooperation with law enforcement agencies for a DrugFreeSG. CNBOntheMove Full Media Statement: go.gov.sg/cnb-ncid-oct2021IntheNews: Press Conference: ,

Monitored by CNB since July 2021, the Malaysian-based syndicate was believed to have been trafficking drugs using Singapore-based freight forwarding companies, as legitimate forwarding agents, to deliver parcels which contain concealed drugs to other countries through Singapore. The swift arrest was the result of the strong collaboration between CNB & NCID, RMP. CNB will continue to maintain close international cooperation with law enforcement agencies for a DrugFreeSG. CNBOntheMove Full Media Statement: go.gov.sg/cnb-ncid-oct2021IntheNews: Press Conference: ,

caption: . ; In the latest drug bust by CNB on 25 and 26 Sep 2021 in multiple locations of Singapore, a total of about 4,342g of heroin, 191g of Ice, 15g of cannabis, 207g of Ecstasy tablets, 142 Erimin-5 tablets, and ten LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $328,000. The 4,342g of heroin seized is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 2,070 abusers for a week. Investigations are ongoing. caption: CNBOnTheMove: , , In a two-week island-wide operation from 16 to 27 Aug 2021, 161 suspected drug offenders were arrested at areas including Lakeside, Potong Pasir, Seng Kang, Teck Whye and Woodlands. The youngest arrested was a 17 year-old Singaporean female suspected of drug abuse.Drugs estimated worth more than $253,000 were seized with a total of about 3,069g of heroin, 544g of Ice, 53g of cannabis, 37g of ketamine, 31 Ecstasy tablets, 116 Erimin-5 tablets, and 11 bottles of methadone.Full Story:

caption: IntheNews: . Drugs hidden in buttons? As reported in Lianhe Wanbao (19 Aug), Tokyo Metropolitan police arrested three individuals who attempted to smuggle 2.6 kg of drugs, estimated to be worth $1.88 mil, with 1331 buttons. Each button held about 2g of drugs and were sewn onto 73 pieces of clothing. The clothing were shipped from the UK to Tokyo in the first half of August.Indeed, drug syndicates will try ways and means to traffic drugs, to profit off addiction. Our officers will remain alert and vigilant to ensure that our streets remain drugfree.

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE- 12 arrested during CNB Anti-Drug Operations; Drugs seized estimated to be worth more than $152,000In the latest drug bust on 3 and 4 August 2021, a total of about 624g of Ice, 2,375g of cannabis, 53g of ketamine, 413 Ecstasy tablets and fragments, 602 Erimin-5 tablets, 226 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, 161g of substances believed to be controlled drugs, and 116 bottles containing liquid believed to be laced with controlled drugs were seized in multiple locations in Singapore. This is CNBs second anti-drug operation targeted at drug syndicates in a week eight suspected drug offenders were previously arrested on 27 July 2021, which saw the total seizure of close to $749,000 worth of controlled drugs.The total amount of Ice and cannabis seized from both the 27 July, and 3 and 4 August operations are sufficient to feed the addiction of more than 2,150 abusers for a week.Investigations are ongoing. Read more:

This is CNB's second anti-drug operation targeted at drug syndicates in a week; eight suspected drug offenders were previously arrested on 27 July 2021, which saw the total seizure of close to $749,000 worth of controlled drugs. caption: BAKING TROUBLE YET AGAIN - 42 baked goods and crumbs believed to be infused with cannabis seized, along with other drugs CNBONTHEMOVE In the latest drug busts that took place in multiple locations in Singapore on 27 July, CNB officers seized a total of about 42 baked goods and crumbs believed to be infused with cannabis, 2.5kg of Ice, 164g of cannabis, 7g of ketamine, 54 Ecstasy tablets, 9,831 Erimin-5 tablets, 5 LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, and 111 packets containing substances believed to be controlled drugs. Various drug paraphernalia were also recovered in one of the operations.A total of 5 males and 3 females were arrested for suspected drug-related activities.Investigations are ongoing.Read more here:

caption: - - -- - CNBONTHEMOVEIn an island-wide operation from 12 to 16 Jul 2021, CNB officers arrested 104 suspected drug offenders and seized a total of about 1.8kg of 'Ice', 535g of Ecstasy' tablets, 191g of heroin, 5g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS) and 6 Ecstasy tablets. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $198,000. Three very young children were also found during the operations and in close proximity to where suspected illegal drug consumption or activities had taken placed. Their welfare was taken care of and they have been placed in the safe custody of their next-of-kin.One of them was a 10-month-old baby. An officer who was at the scene (pictured) had this to say - "As a father to two daughters, I instinctively knew that the baby needed to drink milk when I saw her crying. It saddens me to see such innocent victims being brought up in such an environment. This is the reason why CNB officers are motivated to give our best in our work"News release:
cleaned_caption: CNBONTHEMOVE In an island-wide operation from 12 to 16 Jul 2021, CNB officers arrested 104 suspected drug offenders and seized a total of about 1.8kg of 'Ice', 535g of 'Ecstasy' tablets, 191g of heroin, 5g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS) and 6 Ecstasy tablets. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $198,000. Three very young children were also found during the operations and in close proximity to where suspected illegal drug consumption or activities had taken place. Their welfare was taken care of and they have been placed in the safe custody of their next-of-kin. One of them was a 10-month-old baby. An officer who was at the scene had this to say - "As a father to two daughters, I instinctively knew that the baby needed to drink milk when I saw her crying. It saddens me to see such innocent victims being brought up in such an environment. This is the reason why CNB officers are motivated to give our best in our work." News release:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: CLOSE TO 1KG OF HEROIN SEIZED IN CNB OPERATIONIn the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 5 July 2021, a total of about 974g of heroin, 3g of cannabis, and 60g of suspected New Psychoactive Substances (NPS) were seized. Cash amounting to $57,929 and 330 nitrazepam tablets were also recovered during the operation. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $102,000. The total amount of 974g of heroin seized is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 460 abusers for a week. Two Singaporean suspected drug offenders, comprising of a 65-year-old male and a 55-year-old female, were arrested.Investigations are ongoing. Read more:

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE - MORE THAN 10KG OF CONTROLLED DRUGS SEIZED; FOUR ARRESTED FOR SUSPECTED DRUG ACTIVITIES In the latest drug busts by Central Narcotics Bureau (CNB) officers on 30 June 2021, a total of about 7,959g of heroin, 2,159g of Ice, 423g of cannabis, 202g of ketamine, about 1,451 Ecstasy tablets and about 300 Erimin-5 tablets were seized during the operation that took place in multiple locations in Singapore. caption: Check out these behind-the-scenes photos of the creators of the VR mobile game app - students from . Hear what inspired them to develop Man in the Mirror and contribute to the drug-free cause! The team wanted something different from existing efforts. We wanted to see if we could build a game that would help players empathise with the vulnerability of falling into substance abuse and addiction, with the aid of VR technology. However, all this would not have been possible without the story. While crafting the story, the team had many discussions on what we should focus on, be it pre- or post-abuse. We also considered the perspectives of abusers. Ultimately, we want to convey to our audience that prevention is better than cure, and inspire a sense of hope for those who wish to break free from addiction. ICYMI: The giveaway contest on Facebook is still ongoing till 4 June 2021! Like, comment a screenshot of the Man in the Mirror on your mobile devices, and hashtag DrugFreeSG for a chance to win a customised VR cardboard headset!

caption: CNBOnTheMove: OVER 10KG OF ILLICIT DRUGS SEIZED; 2 SUSPECTS ARRESTED In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 25 May, a total of about 5.6KG of heroin, 2.5KG of Ice, 2.5KG of cannabis, 192 Ecstasy tablets, and seven Erimin-5 tablets were seized. Cash amounting to $28,000 and 703 nitrazepam tablets were also recovered during the operation, which took place in the vicinity of Fernvale Road. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $944,000. Two Singaporeans a 45-year-old male and a 31-year-old female, were arrested for suspected drug activities. Prior to the raid, two children, an 11-year-old boy and 10-year-old girl, were playing outside the unit. They were later established to be the children of the 31-year-old female suspect. Arrangements were made to ensure that the welfare of the children were taken care of. The children were subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin.Children are the unfortunate victims in many of such drug offences. Drug traffickers not only destroy the lives of others through their selfish and nefarious acts, but also bring pain and misery to their family and children. Parents play a key role in nurturing and guiding their children, and to keep them out of harms way. CNB endeavours to keeping the streets of Singapore safe from drugs through our rigorous enforcement actions and will continue to reach out to parents and work with them to guide their children towards a healthy, drug-free lifestyle. Mr Sebastian Tan, Deputy Director CNB (Operations)Investigations are ongoing.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: OVER 7KG OF ILLICIT DRUGS SEIZED; SEVEN SUSPECTS ARRESTEDOn 18 May, CNB officers conducted two operations which saw the seizure of a total of about 5KG of Ice, 2.2KG of heroin, 6g of cannabis, 1g of ketamine, more than 630g of Ecstasy tablets, 201 Erimin-5 tablets, and one LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamp, along with cash amounting to $4,585. Seven suspected drug offenders, comprising six males and one female aged between 26 and 48, were arrested. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $850,000. The operations took place at multiple locations, including in the vicinity of Jurong East Ave 1, Chai Chee Street and Lorong Limau. Investigations are ongoing. Photo 1 (CNB): Illicit drugs, including Ice and Ecstasy tablets, recovered from a safe in the vicinity of Lorong Limau on 18 May 2021.Photo 2 (CNB): About 466g of heroin, which was concealed inside a fire extinguisher, seized from a residential unit in the vicinity of Jurong East Ave 1 on 18 May 2021.

CNBOnTheMove CNB247

caption: LATEST: 15-YEAR-OLD AMONG 92 SUSPECTS ARRESTED FOR DRUG OFFENCES In the latest island-wide operation conducted by CNB from 4 to 9 Apr, a total of about 129g of heroin, 49g of Ice, 2g of cannabis, 52g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), 1g of ketamine, 17 Ecstasy tablets, 30 Erimin-5 tablets, and eight LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $15,000. A total of 92 suspected drug offenders were arrested, and the youngest arrested in this island-wide operation is a 15-year-old Singaporean female suspected drug abuser. Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation include Ang Mo Kio, Bedok, Jurong and Punggol. Photo: Improvised lighters and heroin seized from a 43-year-old Singaporean females vehicle in the vicinity of Ang Mo Kio Ave 4 on 5 April 2021. CNBOnTheMove

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE: 2KG OF CANNABIS SEIZEDIn the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 29 Mar, a total of one bundle containing about 323g of 'Ice' and two bundles containing about 2kg of cannabis were recovered from within a blue plastic bag in the operation. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $72,000. The total amount of 323g of 'Ice' that had been seized in the operation is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 184 abusers for a week, while the total amount of 2kg of cannabis that had been seized in the operation is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 285 abusers for a week.One Singaporean male was arrested for suspected drug activities.Investigations are ongoing.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: MORE THAN 35KG OF ILLICIT DRUGS SEIZED; DRUGS SUFFICIENT TO FEED MORE THAN 10,000 ABUSERS FOR A WEEK In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 16 and 17 Mar, three Singaporean males, aged between 27 and 33, were arrested for suspected drug-related offences. In total, over 35kg of illicit drugs were seized - including about 20.5kg of cannabis, 8.3kg of heroin, 6.4kg of Ice, about 1,091 Ecstasy tablets and 1,000 Erimin-5 tablets. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $1.7 million. Investigations are ongoing. The total amount of drugs seized in the operation is sufficient to feed 3,950 heroin abusers, 3,700 Ice abusers and 2,930 cannabis abusers for a week. At CNB and the Home Team, we believe that drugs have no place in Singapore and we are committed to keep our streets safe from drugs.

caption: 200 VIALS OF FENTANYL SEIZED, 3 ARRESTED BY CNBOn 1 March, ICA officers from Changi Airfreight Centre, Air Cargo Command noticed anomalies in the scanned images of a parcel declared as medicine from Vietnam. 200 vials believed to contain about 20mg of fentanyl were uncovered. Other illicit medicines were also found in the parcel. CNBOnTheMove: This detection prompted a follow-up operation by CNB officers, and the intended recipient of the parcel, a 30-year-old female Singapore Permanent Resident, was arrested in the vicinity of Beach Road. Two other Singaporean males (aged 62 and 25) were also arrested for suspected drug-related offences. The three suspects were escorted to their hideout, an apartment in the same vicinity. During a search of the apartment, other illicit medicines were found from within and HSA was alerted. Investigations into the drug activities of all the suspects are ongoing. DidYouKnow: Fentanyl is known to be a very potent opioid, approximately 50-100 times more potent than morphine. The abuse of fentanyl results in similar effects to other opioids, such as nausea, drowsiness, respiratory depression, low blood pressure and slow heart rate. Due to its potency, fentanyl abuse brings with it a heightened risk of death as a result of overdosing and there have been many cases in overseas jurisdictions of overdose deaths relating to fentanyl and its derivatives.CNB would like to remind the public that fentanyl and its derivatives are listed as Class A controlled drugs under Singapores Misuse of Drugs Act (MDA). The possession, consumption, importation or trafficking of any controlled drug is an offence under the MDA.
cleaned_caption: 200 VIALS OF FENTANYL SEIZED, 3 ARRESTED BY CNB. On 1 March, ICA officers from Changi Airfreight Centre, Air Cargo Command noticed anomalies in the scanned images of a parcel declared as medicine from Vietnam. 200 vials believed to contain about 20mg of fentanyl were uncovered. Other illicit medicines were also found in the parcel. CNBOnTheMove: This detection prompted a follow-up operation by CNB officers, and the intended recipient of the parcel was arrested in the vicinity of Beach Road. Two other Singaporean males were also arrested for suspected drug-related offences. The three suspects were escorted to their hideout, an apartment in the same vicinity. During a search of the apartment, other illicit medicines were found, and HSA was alerted. Investigations into the drug activities of all the suspects are ongoing. DidYouKnow: Fentanyl is known to be a very potent opioid, approximately 50-100 times more potent than morphine. The abuse of fentanyl results in similar effects to other opioids, such as nausea, drowsiness, respiratory depression, low blood pressure, and slow heart rate. Due to its potency, fentanyl abuse brings with it a heightened risk of death as a result of overdosing and there have been many cases in overseas jurisdictions of overdose deaths relating to fentanyl and its derivatives. CNB would like to remind the public that fentanyl and its derivatives are listed as Class A controlled drugs under Singapore's Misuse of Drugs Act (MDA). The possession, consumption, importation, or trafficking of any controlled drug is an offence under the MDA.

caption: 2 MARCH DRAMA: 8 ARRESTED FOR SUSPECTED DRUG ACTIVITIES In the latest CNB operation on 2 March 2021, seven Singaporeans and one Malaysian (aged between 20 to 71) were arrested for suspected drug activities. A total of about 2kg of Ice, 928g of cannabis, 51g of heroin, 1g of cocaine, more than 4,000 Ecstasy tablets, and 106 Erimin-5 tablets were seized, along with cash amounting to $3,000. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth over $326,000. The arrests took place in the vicinity of Jalan Bukit Merah and Sumang Walk. During the raid of a residential unit around Jalan Bukit Merah, one of suspects, a 32-year-old Malaysian male, attempted to evade arrest by scaling out of the window of the unit located on the second storey. In the process, he fell and suffered injuries. He was conveyed conscious to the Singapore General Hospital for medical attention. He is currently in stable condition. Investigations into the drug activities of all the suspects are ongoing. CNBOnTheMove

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE: MORE THAN 3KG OF HEROIN AND 3,000 ECSTASY TABLETS SEIZED In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 25 and 26 Feb 2021, a total of 3,036g of heroin, 1,510g of 'Ice', 993g of cannabis, 7g of ketamine, more than 3,000 'Ecstasy' tablets and capsules, 15 Erimin-5 tablets, and a bottle of methadone were seized. Cash amounting to $47,879 was also recovered during the operation, which took place in multiple locations. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $480,000. In one of the cases, CNB officers arrested a 35-year-old Singaporean male for suspected drug trafficking offences in the vicinity of Jalan Eunos. As the officers moved in to arrest the suspect, the 35-year-old male had put up a violent struggle and necessary force was used to subdue him. A search was conducted on him, and a total of about 328g of heroin, 122g of 'Ice', 6g of ketamine, 93 'Ecstasy' tablets, 15 Erimin-5 tablets were seized, along with cash amounting to $18,900. A total of three Singaporeans were arrested for suspected drug activities. Investigations are ongoing.Read the full story here:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 16-YEAR-OLD ARRESTED, AMONG 76 SUSPECTED DRUG OFFENDERS IN CNB ISLAND-WIDE OPERATIONIn an island-wide operation conducted by CNB from 21 to 26 Feb, an assortment of drugs including a total of about 866g of heroin, 588g of Ice, 568g of cannabis, 44g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), some ketamine, Ecstasy tablets, Erimin-5 tablets, and LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $135,000. The youngest arrested in this island-wide operation is a 16-year-old Singaporean female suspected drug abuser. Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation include Ang Mo Kio, Bedok and Bukit Batok.Investigations are ongoing.

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE: CLOSE TO 7.5KG OF ILLICIT DRUGS WORTH $0.4 MILLION SEIZEDIn the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 16 Feb 2021, a total of 3,720g of heroin, 2,934g of cannabis, 813g of 'Ice', and one Erimin-5 tablet were seized during the operation that took place in multiple locations in Singapore, along with cash amounting to $9,370. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $401,000. 2 Singaporeans and 1 Malaysian were arrested for suspected drug activities. In one of the cases, CNB officer raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Edgedale Plains. The occupant, a 24-year-old Singaporean male suspected drug offender, refused CNB officers entry into the unit and attempted to evade arrest by scaling out of the window of the unit located on the 17th storey. He was subsequently pulled to safety by CNB officers. A search was conducted in the unit, and a total of six packets containing about 776g of 'Ice' and two blocks weighing about 1,914g of cannabis were seized.Investigations are ongoing.

In one of the cases, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Edgedale Plains. The occupant, a 24-year-old Singaporean male suspected drug offender, refused CNB officers entry into the unit and attempted to evade arrest by scaling out of the window of the unit located on the 17th storey. He was subsequently pulled to safety by CNB officers. A search was conducted in the unit, and a total of six packets containing about 776g of 'Ice' and two blocks weighing about 1,914g of cannabis were seized. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: OVER 1KG OF HEROIN AND CANNABIS SEIZED; 4 ARRESTED In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 19 Jan, an assortment of drugs including about 1.4kg of heroin, 1kg of cannabis, 135g of Ice and some Erimin-5 and Ecstasy tablets worth close to $141,000 were seized. Four suspects were arrested. Forced entry was effected in a residential unit in the vicinity of Telok Blangah Drive, as the occupants had refused to heed the lawful orders of the CNB officers to open the door. Four Singaporean males, aged 49, 51, 56 and 61, were arrested therein. A search was conducted, and a total of ten packets and bundles containing about 1,487g of heroin, 15 packets containing about 135g of Ice, a bundle containing about 1,048g of cannabis, 10 Ecstasy tablets and 109 Erimin-5 tablets were recovered from various locations within and in the vicinity of the unit. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: 89 SUSPECTED DRUG OFFENDERS ARRESTED IN CNB ISLAND-WIDE OPERATION ; SUSPECTED DRUG OFFENDERS' 5 AND 6-YEAR-OLD CHILDREN PRESENT DURING ARREST CNBOnTheMoveIn the latest island-wide operation by CNB, a total of 89 suspected drug offenders were arrested, and a total of about 608g of heroin, 113g of 'Ice', 109g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), 25g of cannabis, 11 Erimin-5 tablets, 8 'Ecstasy' tablet and 2 bottles of methadone were seized. Various drug paraphernalia and offensive weapons were also recovered. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth more than $15,000.In one of the cases, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Tampines Street 21 and arrested a Singaporean couple. During the raid, the couple's children, a 5-year-old and 6-year-old, were also present in the unit. Preliminary investigations showed that the couple would abuse drugs together in their home and had last abused drugs the night before their arrest. The children were subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin.In another case, CNB officers arrested a 22-year-old Singaporean female in the vicinity of Merpati Road, where a packet containing about 0.3g of 'Ice' found concealed in a wireless earphone casing was recovered from her. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: Congratulations to all schools who won the top 10 highest participation rate and the best anti-drug montage* for the Anti-Drug Ambassador Activity (AAA) 2020! Special shoutout to Fernvale Primary School and Alexandra Primary School for including the montage in their Art lessons, and Pei Chun Public School for involving parents in witnessing their children pledge to a DrugFreeSG! Wed like to thank all schools for their participation and support for AAA 2020. Stay tuned for AAA 2021, coming soon! *All results are final

caption: (3) CNBONTHEMOVE LATEST ISLAND-WIDE OPERATION (23 TO 27 NOV): SUSPECT HID IN STOREROOM BEHIND FALSE WALL IN AN ATTEMPT TO EVADE ARRESTIn another operation on 26 Nov, CNB officers raided a flat in the vicinity of Edgefield Plains, and arrested a 25-year-old Singaporean male and 24-year-old Singaporean female. A total of 32 packets containing about 631g of Ice, 3 packets containing about 113g of cannabis, and 16 Ecstasy tablets were seized. Cash amounting to $25,393 was also recovered from the unit.During the raid, CNB officers detected a storeroom behind a false wall. Officers moved in swiftly and arrested the 25-year-old Singaporean male who was hiding in the storeroom. The 25-year-old male had put up a struggle to resist arrest, and necessary force was used to subdue him.Investigations are ongoing.

During the raid, CNB officers detected a storeroom behind a false wall. Officers moved in swiftly and arrested the 25-year-old Singaporean male who was hiding in the storeroom. The 25-year-old male had put up a struggle to resist arrest, and necessary force was used to subdue him. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: (2) CNBONTHEMOVE LATEST ISLAND-WIDE OPERATION (23 TO 27 NOV): TWO MOTHERS, AGED 19 AND 26, WERE USING DRUGS IN FRONT OF THEIR FIVE-YEAR-OLD AND FOUR-MONTH-OLD CHILDREN In another case on 23 Nov, CNB officers raided a residential unit in the vicinity of Lengkok Bahru, and arrested three suspects a 29-year-old Singaporean male, a 26-year-old Singaporean male and a 19-year-old Singaporean female. A 26-year-old Singaporean female who later returned to the same unit was also promptly arrested for suspected drug activities. A total of six packets containing about 3g of Ice were recovered in the unit, while drug paraphernalia were found on the 26-year-old Singaporean female.The 5-year-old son of the 26-year-old female, and the 4-month-old son of the 19-year-old female were also present during the arrest. Preliminary investigations showed that the 19-year-old female had brought her 4-month-old infant to visit the unit, and later abused drugs along with the 29-year-old male and 26-year-old male in the unit. Appropriate arrangements were made to ensure that the welfare of both children were taken care of. Both children were subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin.Investigations are ongoing.

A total of six packets containing about 3g of Ice were recovered in the unit, while drug paraphernalia were found on the 26-year-old Singaporean female. The 5-year-old son of the 26-year-old female and the 4-month-old son of the 19-year-old female were also present during the arrest. Preliminary investigations showed that the 19-year-old female had brought her 4-month-old infant to visit the unit, and later abused drugs along with the 29-year-old male and 26-year-old male in the unit. Appropriate arrangements were made to ensure that the welfare of both children were taken care of. Both children were subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: (1) CNBONTHEMOVE LATEST ISLAND-WIDE OPERATION (23 TO 27 NOV): DRUGS FOUND CONCEALED IN SKINCARE PRODUCT PACKAGING From 23 to 27 Nov, a total of 87 suspects were arrested in an island-wide operation conducted by CNB.In one of the cases on 23 Nov, CNB officers arrested a 39-year-old Singaporean male in the vicinity of Sumang Lane. 15 packets containing about 339g of Ice, seven Ecstasy tablets, and 90 Erimin-5 tablets were recovered from the suspects residential unit. Five bottles and a packet containing liquid believed to be liquid methamphetamine concealed in skincare product packaging were also seized from the unit, along with various drug paraphernalia. Investigations are ongoing. In the island-wide operation, a total of over 1.1KG of Ice, 1.4KG of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), 764g of heroin, and other drugs including cannabis, ketamine, Ecstasy tablets, Erimin-5 tablets, LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps, and five bottles and a packet containing liquid believed to be liquid methamphetamine were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $400,000.Some of the areas covered during this island-wide operation include Boon Lay, Buangkok and Aljunied.

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE: OVER 1KG OF ICE SEIZED, 5 ARRESTED On 16 and 17 Nov, CNB officers seized over 1.3KG of Ice, and a large assortment of drugs including cannabis, ketamine, Ecstasy tablets and fragments, Erimin-5 tablets, Yaba tablets, LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) stamps and liquid suspected to contain GHB (gamma-hydroxybutyrate). Cash amounting to $18,250, and weapons such as a Karambit knife, watermelon knives, parang knife and baseball bat were also recovered during the operation, which took place at multiple locations in the vicinity of Somme Road, Yishun Ring Road and Balestier Road. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $410,000. Five suspects were arrested. Investigations are ongoing. The total amount of 1,314g of Ice seized is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 750 abusers for a week.

caption: CNBONTHEMOVE: 14KG HEROIN SEIZED, 5 SUSPECTS ARRESTED In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 11 Nov, a total of about 14.1KG of heroin, 7.5KG of cannabis, 2.8KG of Ice, 1,008 Erimin-5 tablets, and some Ecstasy fragments and Ecstasy tablets were seized. Cash amounting to $12,629 was also seized from the operation that took place in multiple locations - including the vicinity of Siglap Road and Bedok Reservoir Road. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth close to $2 million. Five suspects, comprising three men and two women aged between 29 and 55 were arrested. Investigations are ongoing. The total amount of drugs seized in the operation is sufficient to feed 6,740 heroin abusers for a week, 1,630 Ice abusers for a week and 1,080 cannabis abusers for a week. Drug traffickers take huge gambles by exploiting and capitalising on addiction and the misery that drug abuse brings to the family. CNB has been keeping a close watch on the drug situation and will not let up on our enforcement efforts. CNB is committed to keeping the streets of Singapore safe from drugs, and would like to remind the public that the consumption, possession, trafficking, import or export of any controlled drugs is an offence under the Misuse of Drugs Act. Singapore has strict laws for drug trafficking and CNB will continue to mount regular, sustained operations against drug traffickers and abusers alike, to keep the streets of Singapore drug-free.

caption: CNBOnTheMove: 168 DRUG OFFENDERS ARRESTED IN CNB 2-WEEK ISLAND-WIDE OPERATIONA total of 168 suspected drug offenders were arrested by CNB officers in an island-wide operation from 5 to 16 Oct 2020. In this two-week island-wide operation, a total of about 561g of cannabis, about 433g of 'Ice', about 303g of heroin, about 61g of New Psychoactive Substances (NPS), about 1g of ketamine, 19 'Ecstasy' tablets, 19 Erimin-5 tablets, 12 bottles of cannabis vape cartridges, eight bottles of black liquid believed to contain opium, and one bottle of liquid believed to contain GHB (gamma-hydroxybutyrate) were seized. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth about $163,000. In one of the cases, the 3-year-old daughter of a 31-year-old Singaporean female, who was arrested for suspected drug activities, was present in the unit during the raid. Arrangements were made to ensure that the welfare of the 3-year-old girl was taken care of. The girl was subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin.Investigations are ongoing.Read the full story here:

caption: CNBOnTheMove: LARGE ASSORTMENT OF DRUGS INCLUDING 3.6KG OF ICE SEIZED, 11 SUSPECTS ARRESTED In the latest drug bust by CNB officers on 7 and 8 Oct, eleven suspected drug offenders were arrested at multiple locations in Singapore - including Jalan Selamat, Lorong Limau, Tampines, Aljunied Crescent and Upper Weld Road. A large assortment of drugs including 3.6kg of Ice, nearly 1kg of cannabis, 265g of heroin, some ketamine, Ecstasy tablets and Erimin-5 tablets worth about $1.2million were seized. Cash amounting to $15,784 was also recovered during the operation. In one of the cases, more than 1kg of Ice and about 398g of ketamine were recovered from a bicycle in the vicinity of Aljunied Crescent.Investigations into the drug activities of all the suspects are ongoing. The total amount of 3,651g of Ice seized is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 2,100 abusers for a week.

caption: NEVER A NEED FOR SPEED: $160,000 WORTH OF ICE AND HEROIN SEIZED IN VEHICLE INTERCEPTED BY CNB OFFICERS CNBOnTheMove In the evening of 2 Oct, CNB officers intercepted a vehicle in the vicinity of Netheravon Road, and arrested a 56-year-old Singaporean male. A search of the vehicle was conducted, and two bundles containing about 527g of Ice and two packets containing about 18g of heroin were recovered. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth $160,000. Prior to the arrest, a 38-year-old Malaysian male was believed to have left a package in the vicinity of Changi Coast Road, which was then collected by the 56-year-old Singaporean. The 38-year-old Malaysian male was later arrested in the vicinity of Nicoll Drive. In a series of follow-up operations, CNB officers arrested one other Singaporean male and one Malaysian male at various locations, for suspected drug activities.527g of Ice is sufficient to feed the addiction of about 300 abusers for a week. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: 122 PACKETS OF HEROIN (858g) AND 71 PACKETS OF ICE (133g) SEIZED IN RAID ON HOTEL ROOMS NEAR BEACH RD; SUSPECTED TRAFFICKER OPENLY DISPLAYED DRUGS TO 12-YEAR-OLD SON CNBOnTheMoveIn the latest two-week island-wide operation by CNB, a total of 162 suspected drug offenders were arrested, and an assortment of drugs including about 870g of heroin, 586g of Ice, some Ecstasy tablets, Erimin-5 tablets, ketamine, New Psychoactive Substances (NPS) and GHB (gamma-hydroxybutyrate) estimated to be worth about $260,500 were seized. The youngest arrested is a 14-year-old suspected drug abuser.In one of the cases, CNB officers raided two hotel rooms in the vicinity of Beach Road, and arrested five Singaporeans. Drugs including 122 packets containing about 858g of heroin and 71 packets containing about 133g of Ice were recovered from two rooms in the hotel. A Karambit knife was also seized in one of the rooms, along with various drug paraphernalia.During the raid, it was found that a 35-year-old male suspected drug trafficker had his 12-year-old son with him, and the drugs displayed openly in front of his son in the room. The boy's mother, a 36-year-old, was also arrested during the raid for suspected drug offences. The boy was subsequently placed in the safe custody of a next-of-kin. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: 1.5KG OF HEROIN, 1.2KG OF ICE AND OTHER DRUGS WORTH MORE THAN HALF A MILLION DOLLARS SEIZED IN LATEST CNB DRUG BUST On 8 Sep, CNB officers seized a large assortment of drugs - including about 1.5kg of heroin, about 1.2kg of Ice, 7,502 Erimin-5 tablets, 669 Ecstasy tablets, 512g of ketamine and 10g of cannabis. Cash amounting to $8,680 was also recovered. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth about $640,000. Two Singaporean suspects - a 30-year-old male and 28-year-old female, were arrested. A search by CNB officers of the 30-year-old male suspects residential unit recovered up to 24 packets and bottles of Ice and other drugs, along with packaging materials. A subsequent search of his vehicle recovered three bundles of heroin. Investigations are ongoing. CNBOnTheMove

caption: CNBOnTheMove: $230,000 WORTH OF DRUGS SEIZED; FIVE ARRESTED On 27 Aug, CNB officers intercepted a car in the vicinity of Ang Mo Kio Ave 5 and seized about 550g of Ice from within the vehicle. Two suspects were arrested. A subsequent search of one of the suspects residence saw the seizure of about 291g of heroin and a bundle containing around 1kg of cannabis. In a follow-up operation in the vicinity of Bukit Panjang Ring Road, CNB officers recovered another 1kg of cannabis and arrested two suspects. Prior to the arrest, one of the suspects was believed to have discarded a package containing about 965g of cannabis out of a residential units window. The drugs seized are estimated to be worth $230,000 in total. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: Our participants had a great time at the videography workshop today! We invited two accomplished filmmakers, and , to share some useful tips on video production in light of the upcoming DrugFreeSG Video Competition.Hear what our workshop participant Jing En has to say: 'I want to spread anti-drug awareness in my school so that people understand that drugs are harmful and it affects your family as well. This workshop is a good experience for me as I do not have many opportunities in school to learn about filmmaking in great detail. This workshop also taught me how to produce a good story.' We're looking forward to their ideas!

caption: Latest: About 3.5kg of Cannabis, 2.94kg of Heroin, and an assortment of Ice, Erimin-5 tablets, and Ecstasy tablets were seized in an operation conducted by the CNB in the evening of 20 Nov 2018. Worth over S$305,000, the drugs seized were enough to feed the addiction of about 1,900 abusers for a week. Investigations into the drug activities of the three arrested suspects are ongoing.CNBonthemove

caption: Last week, welfare packs were distributed to students at the National University of Singapore (NUS). This was a project initiated by one of our Anti-Drug Advocates - Tan Ruo Lin, to rally support for the anti-drug cause and to encourage her peers to join our Anti-Drug Advocate (ADA) programme. Thank you all for your enthusiasm in our ADA programme, and for supporting a DrugFreeSG!Dont worry if you missed it. For more information on the ADA programme, you may visit the link in our bio.

caption: Yesterday, a 27-year-old male foreign national was arrested when he was entering Singapore. He was wanted for an earlier case of forgery for the purpose of cheating. A search of his luggage found a total of about 3kg of Cannabis and 4,831 Yaba tablets. The Cannabis were hidden within canisters and boxes labelled as containing food items. The Yaba tablets and fragments were found hidden within a handphone box. Follow-up investigations by CNB led to the arrest of the suspected intended recipient of the drugs found in the luggage. Investigations are ongoing.

The Yaba tablets and fragments were found hidden within a handphone box. Follow-up investigations by CNB led to the arrest of the suspected intended recipient of the drugs found in the luggage. Investigations are ongoing.

caption: Last night, CNB conducted two separate operations and more than S$197,000 worth of drugs were seized. 7 suspected drug offenders were arrested during the operations. In one of the cases, it was believed that the drug offenders booked a room at a hotel in the vicinity of Raffles Boulevard. CNB officers raided the hotel room and arrested two Singaporean male suspects and one female foreign national. Both male suspects put up a violent struggle and necessary force was used to restrain them. A total of about 1,456g of heroin, 1,000g of cannabis, 10g of ice and cash amounting to S$6,250 were recovered from within the room. Investigations into the drug activities of all suspects are ongoing.

caption: Nothing to do this weekend? Head down to Bedok Town Square for our Drug-Free SG Community Roadshow! Happening from 7 to 8 April, 11am to 7pm, there will be a series of fun activities lined up for you! From pet therapy to virtual reality, movie screening and even a live demo by our officers! See you there!
